[[GM G platform (RWD)|G-body]] (1981–1987) | sp = us }} A downsized Regal appeared for the 1978 model year with Buick's new {{convert|196|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} [[V6 engine]] as standard equipment and a revised version of the venerable {{convert|231|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} V6 as an option (which became standard for 1980). Initially, a three-speed [[manual transmission]] was standard but this was later replaced by an automatic. At the time of introduction, Regals were available exclusively as [[coupé]]s with the [[Buick Century|Century]] nameplate applied to bread-and-butter sedans and [[station wagon]]s.{{Cite book | ref = SCBuick | title = Standard Catalog of Buick, 1903-2004 | edition = 3 | first = John | last = Gunnell | publisher = Krause Publications, Inc. | location = Iola, WI | page = 182 | date = 2004 | isbn = 0-87349-760-0 }} In January 1982 the Century was replaced by an all-new car on the [[front-wheel drive]] [[GM A platform (1982)|A platform]], which meant that the Regal gained a four-door sedan and five-door station wagon - essentially facelifted and [[Badge|rebadged]] versions of the previous year's [[rear-wheel drive]] Century. It was the first time the name appeared on a full model lineup. The wagon was discontinued after 1983, and the sedan dropped from the lineup the next year.[[#SCBuick|Gunnell]], pp. 218, 224 This generation Regal lasted ten years. The base model was equipped with softer-riding luxury [[Suspension (vehicle)|suspension]], and did not offer a manual transmission in later years. [[File:Buick Regal -- 08-14-2009.jpg|thumb|left|1978–1979 Buick Regal]] [[File:Regal A-Body.JPG|thumb|left|1980 Buick Regal]] [[File:1982 Buick Regal Wagon two-tone green, front right.jpg|thumb|left|1982 Buick Regal Estate Wagon]] [[File:Buick Regal G-Body.jpg|thumb|left|1982–1987 Buick Regal]] The 1978 Regal could be equipped with a {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} [[Turbocharged]] V6 engine with [[automatic transmission]], and was known as a Regal Sport Coupe. Turbo versions were offered with either a two- or a four-barrel [[carburetor]]. The [[Buick LeSabre]] was also available with the turbocharged engine. The only other turbocharged cars available in the U.S. market in 1978 were imports from [[Mercedes-Benz]], [[Porsche 930|Porsche]] and [[Saab Automobile|Saab]]. The Regal Sport Coupe also included a firm [[Car handling|handling]] suspension with larger tires and sport wheels. Bucket seats and a center console with a T-shifter were also available. A major facelift for 1981 gave the Regal a much more aerodynamic profile, helping make it possible for the car to compete on the [[NASCAR]] racing circuit. The sloping [[Hood (car)|hood]] and nose of the car made it the favorite of several NASCAR teams. [[Richard Petty]] drove one to victory in the [[1981 Daytona 500]], and the car won a majority of the 1981 and 1982 seasons races and won the NASCAR manufacturers title in 1981 and 1982. [[V8 engine|V8]]s for street use were still available, but had shrunk to {{convert|265|cuin|L|1|abbr=on}} (1980 and 1981 only, [[Pontiac]] built), and the V6 was rapidly gaining popularity. From 1986 to 1987, the [[Oldsmobile V8 engine#307|{{convert|307|CID|L|1|abbr=on}} V8]] was available as an option. The {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} 2-bbl V6 was standard. The [[Turbo-Hydramatic#THM200-4R|200-4R]] [[Overdrive (mechanics)|overdrive]] [[Transmission (mechanics)|transmission]] was an option with either engine. For 1980, the Regal was offered in a special '''Somerset Limited Edition''' [[Trim level (automobile)|trim]] which featured unique tan and dark blue designer exterior paint, wire wheel covers, sport [[Wing mirror|mirrors]], and chrome Somerset badging. The interior had tan and blue plush [[velour]] [[Upholstery#Automobile upholstery|upholstery]], brushed [[Chrome plating#Automotive use|chrome]] trim, and additional Somerset badging. A Somerset Limited Edition model was also offered on the restyled 1981 Regal. It had unique dark sandstone and camel exterior paint, sport mirrors, and turbine wheels. The interior plush velour upholstery was camel with dark brown piping. === Grand National, Turbo-T, T-Type, and GNX === In February 1982, the Regal Grand National debuted, which was named for the [[NASCAR Sprint Cup Series|NASCAR Winston Cup Grand National Series]] (the "Grand National" term was part of the Cup series nomenclature until 1986).http://legendarydreamcargarage.com/dreamcargarage/539 Buick had won the Manufacturers Cup in 1981 and 1982, and wanted to capitalize on its success: "What wins on Sunday, sells on Monday". These 1982 cars were not painted black, which may confuse those not familiar with them. All started out as charcoal gray Regals that were shipped off to a subcontractor for finishing. Originally intended for a run of 100 units, Cars and Concepts of [[Brighton, Michigan]], retrofitted 215 Regals with the GN package. Most obvious was the light silver gray firemist paint added to each side. Red [[Pinstriping#Automobiles|pinstripes]] and billboard shadow lettering proclaiming "Buick" were applied. The wheel opening moldings and [[rocker panel]] moldings were blacked out using black vinyl tape. Finally, a front air dam and [[rear spoiler]] were installed. On the inside, special "Lear-Siegler" seats were installed. These seats are fully adjustable and were covered with silver brandon cloth with black vinyl inserts. The front seat had Buick's "6" emblem embroidered onto them. Also, a special clock delete plate was added to the [[Dashboard|instrument panel]] which contained the yellow and orange "6" logo and the words "Grand National Buick Motor Division".) The 1982 GN came with a [[naturally aspirated]] {{convert|252|CID|L|1|abbr=on}} V6 engine with {{convert|125|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4000 rpm and {{convert|205|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of [[torque]] at 2000 rpm. Of the 215 Regal Grand Nationals produced in 1982, at least 35 were based on the Buick Regal Sport coupe package with the turbocharged {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} V6 engine with {{convert|175|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4000 rpm and {{convert|275|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2600 rpm. There were only 2022 Sport coupes produced in 1982, and the number of cars with both the GN and Sport coupe packages is estimated to be fewer than 50. For 1983, there was no Grand National. The Sport coupe model was renamed the [[T-Type]]; 3,732 were produced ({{convert|190|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 1600 rpm and {{convert|280|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2400 rpm). The T-Type had been used on other Buicks, starting with the [[Buick Riviera|Riviera]] in 1981 (in 1979 and 1980, it was the S Type). The 1983 Regal T-Type featured tube [[Exhaust manifold|headers]], Hydro-Boost II [[brake]]s, 200-4R 4-speed overdrive trans and 3.42 [[rear axle]] (7.5").{{cite web|url=http://www.autotraderclassics.com/car-article/Future+Collectible%3A+1986+Buick+Grand+National*T_Type-66683.xhtml |title=Buick Grand National Buyer's Guide |publisher=Autotraderclassics.com |date= |accessdate=2010-10-10}} [[File:Buick T-Type (2669441886).jpg|thumb|Buick Regal T-Type]] For 1984, the Grand National returned, now in all black paint. The [[turbocharged]] {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on}} became standard and was refined with [[sequential fuel injection]], [[distributor]]-less computer controlled [[Ignition system|ignition]], and boasted {{convert|200|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4400 rpm and {{convert|300|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2400 rpm. Only 5,204 turbo Regals were produced that year, only 2,000 of which were Grand Nationals. Because this was the first year production of the computer controlled sequential fuel injection and distributor-less ignition, this is often considered the year and model that started the development of the legendary [[intercooled]] Grand Nationals. The performance of this package was well ahead of its time and the "little V6" easily kept up with the bigger V8s. [[Dragstrip|{{convert|1/4|mi|m|0}}]] performance was listed at 15.9 seconds at stock boost levels of {{convert|10|psi|bar|abbr=on}}, while for the same year, the [[Chevrolet Camaro (third generation)|Chevrolet Camaro]] V6 was listed at 17.0 and the [[Chevrolet Corvette (C4)|Chevrolet Corvette]] at 15.2 seconds. {{Cite web |url=http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/1984-chevrolet-corvette-c4-archived-road-test |title=1984 Corvette (C4) |date=1983-03-01 |publisher=Car and Driver }} Soon, performance enthusiasts determined the modifications that worked and the Grand Nationals easily broke into the 13-second territory. All Grand Nationals had the [[Lear Siegler]]-made cloth/leather interior which was only available for this year. An estimated 200 of the 1984 Grand Nationals were produced with the T-Top option which makes these the rarest of the Grand Nationals. For 1986, a modified engine design with air-air intercooling boosted the performance even further to a specified {{convert|235|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4000 rpm and {{convert|330|lbft|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 2400 rpm. The Grand Nationals (quantity 5,512) and T-Types (quantity 2,384) were both produced in 1986. For 1987, performance reached {{convert|245|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|355|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. Buick dropped the T-Type package for Regal for 1987 models and opted for a "T" sport package instead. There were only 7,896 turbo Regals produced in 1986. In 1987, when turbo Regals reached their peak in popularity, a total of 27,590 turbo Regals were produced through December, with those models produced between September and December of that year window stickered as "1987½ Buick Grand National" vehicles. [[File:WO2T.jpg|thumb|1987 Regal turbo-T Limited with rare blackout trim package]] For 1987, a lightweight WE4 (turbo T) option was offered. Only 1,547 of this variant were produced. The differences between a WE4 and the Grand National were the interior trim package, wheels, exterior badging, aluminum bumper supports, and aluminum rear [[drum brake]]s as opposed to the Grand National's cast iron, making the WE4 a lighter and faster car. The rear spoiler was only available as a dealer installed option. Nineteen eighty-seven was the only year that the LC2 turbo option was available on any Regal, making it possible to even see a Limited with a vinyl [[Landau (automobile)|landau roof]] and a [[power bulge]] turbo hood. Turbo Regal Limiteds were one of the rarest models of turbo Regals produced second only to the GNX at 1,035 turbo Limiteds. Turbo Regal Limiteds could be ordered with many options with most having chrome external trim but for $35 could have been built with the full black-out trim option making them extremely rare. Limiteds were treated to a very luxurious interior with plush carpeting and optional bench pillow seats and a [[Gear stick|column shift]]. The 1987 model would be the end of the manufacture of the [[Rear wheel drive|RWD]] "G-Body" Regal, but [[General Motors|GM]] had to extend the build of the Grand National to meet customer demand into December. [[File:Buick GNX (20206519195).jpg|thumb|Buick Regal GNX]] [[File:Buick GNX (20180268696).jpg|thumb|Buick Regal GNX]] For the final year, 1987, Buick introduced the limited production GNX, for "Grand National Experimental", at $29,900. Made in partnership with [[Linamar|McLaren Performance Technologies]]/[[American Specialty Cars|ASC]], Buick produced only 547 GNs with the interior trim package, that were then sent off to [[Linamar|McLaren]] and upgraded into the Buick GNX. Buick underrated the GNX at {{Convert|276|hp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} at 4400 rpm and a very substantial {{convert|360|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 3000 rpm of [[Torque#Machine torque|torque]],{{cite web |url=https://www.carfolio.com/specifications/models/car/?car=100661 |title=1987 Buick Regal GNX |website=Carfolio.com |accessdate=2018-09-23 |date=2013-02-28}} although actual output is {{convert|300|bhp|PS kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|420|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://home.att.net/~buickGNX/GNX/perf.htm |title=GNX Performance |work=BuickGNX.com |accessdate=2007-07-10 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070630104145/http://home.att.net/~buickGNX/GNX/perf.htm |archivedate=June 30, 2007 }} This was created to be the "Grand National to end all Grand Nationals." Changes made included a special [[Garrett AiResearch]] T-3 [[turbocharger]] with a ceramic-impeller blowing through a more efficient and significantly larger capacity [[intercooler]] with a "Cermatel (ceramic-aluminum) coated" pipe connecting the intercooler to the engine. A GNX specific E-EPROM, low-restriction exhaust with dual [[muffler]]s, reprogrammed turbo Hydramatic 200-4R transmission with a custom [[torque converter]] and transmission cooler, and unique [[Differential (mechanical device)|differential]] cover/[[Panhard]] bar included more of the performance modifications. Exterior styling changes include vents located on each front fender, 16 inch black mesh style wheels with VR-speed rated tires, and deletion of the hood and fender emblems. The interior changes of the GNX included a serial number on the dash plaque and a revised instrument cluster providing [[Stewart-Warner]] [[Analog device|analog gauges]],{{cite book |title=Popular Mechanics |date=March 1987 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=HOMDAAAAMBAJ&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false}} including an analog turbo [[boost gauge]]. Performance was measured faster than the [[Ferrari F40]] and the [[Porsche 930]] with a [[Dragstrip|{{convert|1/4|mi|m|0}}]] time of 12.7 seconds at {{Convert|113.1|mi/h|km/h|0|abbr=on}} (0.3 and 0.8 seconds quicker, 2.9 and {{convert|13.3|mph|0|abbr=on}} faster) and a 0-{{convert|60|mph|km/h|0|abbr=on}} time of 4.6 seconds (0.4 and 0.3 seconds quicker, respectively).[http://imgur.com/gallery/uzXOy], ''MotorTrend'', accessed Aug 11, 2016. GNX #001 is the 1986 prototype currently owned by Buick and sometimes makes appearances at car shows around the US. The GNX used a unique [[torque arm]] that was mounted to a special, GNX only, rear differential cover, for increased [[Traction (engineering)|traction]]. The torque arm rear suspension alters the suspension geometry, making the body lift while planting the rear tires down, resulting in increased traction. The stealthy appearance of the all-black GNX and Grand National (and the resemblance of its grill to his helmet's mouthpiece), coupled with the fact that the Grand National was initially released during the popularity of ''[[Star Wars]]'' movies, earned it the title "[[Darth Vader]]'s Car". [[Car and Driver]] covered the GNX model's introduction with the headline "Lord Vader, your car is ready." Due to the turbocharged six cylinder engine, the Buick make, and the black paint Grand Nationals were sometimes referred to as the "Dark Side". The "Dark Side" contrasted with the more common V8 [[Ford Mustang (third generation)|Mustangs]] and Camaros that were popular at the time.{{citation needed|date=December 2019}} {{Clear}} == Third generation (1988) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Third generation | image = Buick gray.jpg | caption = 1988–1989 Buick Regal Limited coupe | model_years = 1988–1996 | production = 1987–October 1996https://www.cars.com/reviews/chicagotribunecoms-view-1420689074485/ | transmission = 4-speed automatic

[[Pontiac Grand Prix#Fifth generation .281988.E2.80.931996.29|Pontiac Grand Prix]] | platform = [[GM W platform|W-body]] | layout = [[FF layout]] | designer = | sp = us }} [[File:'88-'89 Buick Regal (Orange Julep).JPG|thumb|left|1988–1989 Buick Regal GS coupe]] [[File:Buick Regal 2 -- 10-30-2009.jpg|thumb|left|1990–1994 Buick Regal GS sedan]] [[File:1991 Buick Regal Limited.jpg|thumb|left|1991 Buick Regal Limited coupe]] [[File:Buick Regal coupe.jpg|thumb|left|1995–1996 Buick Regal coupe]] [[File:95-96 Buick Regal.jpg|thumb|left|1996 Buick Regal sedan]] A new Regal appeared in October 1987 on the [[GM W platform]] as the first vehicle on that platform;http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-1987-08-30-8703050938-story.html this generation ran with few changes for nine years. Though the new Regal returned to Buick's original concept in being offered only as a coupe and in being aimed once again squarely at the personal luxury buyer, it departed from tradition in being the first front-wheel drive model, and in having no serious performance option or edition. Neither a [[V8 engine|V8]] engine nor a turbocharged [[V6]] was offered; the only engine available for 1988 was the Chevrolet 2.8 L V6, producing {{convert|125|hp|abbr=on}}. From 1990, owing to the declining personal luxury car market, the Regal was again offered as a four-door [[sedan (car)|sedan]] (as were the Cutlass Supreme and Grand Prix the same year, the latter offered as a sedan for the first time). The Regal was initially offered in base ''Custom'' and upscale ''Limited'' trim lines. For 1989, the ''[[Buick Gran Sport#Regal GS / Regal Gran Sport|Gran Sport]]'' trim line was added, featuring aluminum wheels, body side cladding and a console mounted shifter attached to the 4-speed automatic. For 1990, the Regal gained the option of the Buick 3.8 L V6. The 3800 V6 was unique to the Regal, differentiating it from the mechanically similar [[Chevrolet Lumina]], [[Oldsmobile Cutlass Supreme]] and [[Pontiac Grand Prix]]. Anti-lock brakes were made standard on all but the base ''Custom'' cars from 1992, and the grille was redesigned again for 1993. Along with the new look came an electronically controlled [[automatic transmission]] and [[Buick LeSabre|LeSabre]]-like rear lights and bumper. For 1993, a driver's side [[airbag]] was added, along with standard [[Anti-lock braking system|ABS]] on all models, standard power windows, and {{convert|20|hp|0|abbr=on}} more in the base engine due to a revised intake manifold and cylinder head. The ''Limited'' coupe was deleted; only the ''Custom'' and ''Gran Sport (GS)'' coupes remained. Dual airbags were new for 1995 along with a new interior. For 1996, the larger {{convert|3791|cc|L CID|1|abbr=on|order=flip}} V6 engine became the ''3800 Series II'' and gained {{convert|35|hp|0|abbr=on}}. {{citation needed span|Although 1996 was the last model year of this model, sales continued into 1997 as the replacement model was late (arriving in January 1997).|date=October 2018}} === Engines === * 1988–1989 2.8 L (170 in³) [[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#Generation II|Chevrolet LB6]] [[MPFI|MFI]] [[V6]], {{Convert|125|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|160|lbft|0|abbr=on}} * 1989–1993 3.1 L (191 in³) [[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#Generation II|Chevrolet LH0]] MFI V6, {{Convert|140|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|180|lbft|0|abbr=on}} * 1994–1996 3.1 L (191 in³) [[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#Generation III|Chevrolet L82]] SFI V6, {{Convert|160|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|185|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} * 1990–1995 3.8 L (231 in³) [[L27 Naturally Aspirated|Buick L27]] V6, {{Convert|170|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|220|lbft|0|abbr=on}} * 1996 3.8 L (231 in³) [[Buick V6 engine#L36 Naturally Aspirated|Buick L36]] V6, {{Convert|200|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{Convert|225|lbft|Nm|abbr=on}} {{Clear}} == {{anchor|Fourth}} Fourth generation (1997) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Fourth generation | image = Buick Regal GSE.jpg | caption = Buick Regal (US) | aka = Chevrolet Lumina (Philippines) | production = {{ubl | 1996–2004 | China: 1999–2008 || Philippines: 2005–2006 }} | model_years = North America: 1997–2004 | assembly = {{unbulleted list|Canada: [[Oshawa, Ontario]], [[GM Canada]]|China: [[Shanghai]], [[Shanghai GM]]}} | predecessor = | successor = [[Buick LaCrosse]] | body_style = 4-door [[sedan (car)|sedan]] | layout = [[FF layout]] | platform = [[GM W platform|W-body 2nd Gen]] | engine = 2.0 L ''[[Family II engine#L34|L34]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] (China)

Wayne Kady (1993) | sp = us }} {{see also|Buick Century#1997–2005|l1=Buick Century § 1997–2005}} [[File:Buick Regal.jpg|thumb|left|1997–2004 Buick Regal sedan]] For the 1997 model year, the Century and Regal once again rode upon the same platform; the revised [[GM W platform|W platform]] that was shared with the [[Oldsmobile Intrigue]], the [[Pontiac Grand Prix]], the [[Chevrolet Lumina]] and [[Chevrolet Monte Carlo]].https://adage.com/article/news/buick-s-regal-read-costly-web-launch/263/ The Regal coupe was discontinued. Differences between the Regal and Century were mostly cosmetic. As the upmarket version, the Regal offered larger engines and fancier trim, and once again boasted a newer version of the 3.8 L V6. While the Century was mainly a reliable, economy-minded car based upon the W-body, the Regal was fitted with many amenities, including heated leather seats (optional on the Century), a [[Monsoon speakers|Monsoon]] 8-speaker surround sound system, dual climate control, and expansive interior space. Few changes occurred during this version's seven-year run. It offered 5-passenger seating on all trim levels like the Pontiac Grand Prix and Oldsmobile Intrigue (formerly Cutlass Supreme), unlike their predecessors that had optional 6-passenger seating and the Buick Century (formerly built on the [[GM A platform|A platform]]) which had standard 6-passenger seating. This period held the fastest Buick since the days of the 1991–1996 Roadmaster, the Buick Regal GS. This car was now [[supercharged]] instead of turbocharged, and produced {{convert|240|hp|abbr=on|0}} and {{convert|280|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. When introduced in January 1997,http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-1996-08-11-9608110276-story.html Buick advertised the Regal GS as "The official car of the supercharged family".https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LoghkBiMmQk Buick also released two other model types, the LSE and the GSE. The LSE stayed with the {{convert|200|hp|abbr=on|0}} engine with upgrades and the GSE stayed with the {{convert|240|hp|abbr=on|0}} supercharged engine with upgrades. Also, in 2000 Buick came out with a concept GSX that had an intercooled 3.8 L, but was supercharged rather than turbocharged. It had {{convert|295.24|hp|abbr=on}} The North American Regal was replaced in 2005 by the [[Buick LaCrosse]], also built on the W platform. The final 2004 Buick Regal rolled off the assembly line on June 1, 2004.{{cite book |title=Ward's Automotive Yearbook 2005 |publisher=Ward's Communications, Inc |year=2005 |page=112}} === Engines === * 1997–2004 [[GM 3800 engine#L36|3.8]] L L36 Series II [[V6]] * 1997–2004 [[GM 3800 engine#L67|3.8]] L L67 Series II supercharged [[V6]] === Regal LS and GS performance === [[File:Regal l67.jpg|thumb|left|The 3800 Series II L67 Supercharged engine in a 1998 GS]] The Regal LS from the factory had a 1/4 mile (≈400 m) elapsed time (ET) of 15.8 seconds and could do 0-60 mph in under 8 seconds. The supercharged Regal GS had a 1/4 mile ET of 14.9 seconds, and acceleration to {{convert|60|mi/h|km/h|0|abbr=on}} took 6.7 seconds.{{cite web |author=Albee Digital Communications |url=http://www.albeedigital.com/supercoupe/articles/0-60_Quarter_Mile_Times/B_0-60times.html |title="B" 0-60 and 1/4 mile times for Factory Stock Vehicles |publisher=Albeedigital.com |accessdate=2009-06-28 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130410163805/http://www.albeedigital.com/supercoupe/articles/0-60_Quarter_Mile_Times/B_0-60times.html |archivedate=2013-04-10 }} The Regal GS, equipped with the supercharged 3.8 liter V6 engine (L67) produced {{convert|240|hp|abbr=on|0}} & {{convert|280|lb·ft|N.m|abbr=on}} of torque. The Regal GS's PCM has programming that activates torque management to reduce wheel spin at launch. The Regal LS was EPA rated at 19/30 MPG city/freeway while the supercharged Regal GS was EPA rated at 18/27 MPG city/freeway. === Regal LSX and GSX (SLP Performance) === [[File:Buick_Regal_GSX.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal GSX]] In the 2003 and 2004 model years, Buick, in collaboration with SLP Performance, came out with the Buick Regal GSX. They offered dealer-installed options and dealer supplied accessories for both LS and GS models. Like the GS Buicks that came before it, the SLP GSX came in three power train packages, referred to as stages. The Stage 1 package added 10 horsepower with the addition of a dual stainless steel cat-back exhaust system and free-flowing cold air induction system. If you opted for the Stage 2 package, a Hypertech Power Programmer with an SLP custom calibration tune was included with the Stage 1 components — good for an extra 20 horsepower. The range-topping Stage 3 package added a 3.5-inch smaller diameter supercharger pulley to crank up the boost. With an advertised 30 more horsepower than stock, the Stage 3 GSX was conservatively rated at {{convert|270|hp|abbr=on|0}} and {{convert|312|lbft|abbr=on|0}} of torque. Since the parts were available from SLP over the counter for many years, there have been quite a few Regal GS sedans that have been cloned into a GSX for both appearance and performance purposes. Though the model didn’t officially debut until 2003, a licensed SLP dealer could perform the transformation on any Regal GS from 1997 to 2004. A true GSX can be verified from an SLP door jamb label with the correct part number for the kit.https://www.cheatsheet.com/automobiles/buick-regal-gsx-it-lives-up-to-its-performance-heritage.html/{{cite web |url=http://www.fabini.com/slp/slpbuickgsx.html |title=SLP Buick Regal GSX |work=Fabini's Auto Trim Co |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710215458/http://www.fabini.com/slp/slpbuickgsx.html |archivedate=2011-07-10 }} ===Joseph Abboud Edition=== From 2001 to 2004 Buick offered a [[Joseph Abboud]] appearance package on both the GS and LS models. This package included either a solid [[taupe]] or two-tone taupe/[[Chestnut (color)|chestnut]] leather seats, two-tone leather wrapped steering wheel, leather shifter handle and boot, 16" aluminum wheels; and Joseph Abboud signature emblems on the front doors, floor mats, front seat head rests, and taillights. === China === [[File:Buick Regal CN 01 China 2012-06-16.jpg|thumb|left|1999–2008 Buick Regal front quarter (China)]] [[File:Buick Regal CN 02 China 2012-06-16.jpg|thumb|right|1999–2008 Buick Regal rear quarter (China)]] General Motors and [[Shanghai Automotive Industry Corporation]] (SAIC) established a joint venture in 1997 called [[Shanghai GM]], and had begun assembling the Buick Regal in [[Shanghai]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] in April 1999.{{cite web |url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1995%2C_GM_Links_with_SAIC |title=1995, GM Links with SAIC |year=2011 |work=history.gmheritagecenter.com |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z3cvAY0i?url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1995,_GM_Links_with_SAIC# |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=GM signed a milestone agreement with China’s Shanghai Automotive Industry Corporation (SAIC) for a proposed automotive joint venture, a joint venture technical center, and several other projects in and around the city of Shanghai... |url-status=dead }}{{cite web |url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1982_-1999,_Globalization,_One_Company,_One_Team |title=1982 -1999, Globalization, One Company, One Team |year=2011 |work=history.gmheritagecenter.com |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z3Uy5pg2?url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1982_-1999,_Globalization,_One_Company,_One_Team# |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=Also in 1995, the company entered into a joint venture agreement with Shanghai Automotive Industry Corporation (SAIC) in China, laying the foundation for unprecedented growth over the next few years. Four years later, the Buick Regal was being assembled in China for the Chinese market... |url-status=dead }}{{cite web |url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1999,_Buick_is_Back_in_Shanghai |title=1999, Buick is Back in Shanghai |year=2011 |work=history.gmheritagecenter.com |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z3V6i6Em?url=http://history.gmheritagecenter.com/wiki/index.php/1999,_Buick_is_Back_in_Shanghai# |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=The General Motors-SAIC joint venture plant in Shanghai began building Buick Regals for the Chinese market, marking the Buick brand’s proud return to China. |url-status=dead }} The Regal has sold well in the Chinese market as a large, relatively luxurious model, despite its high price, costing more than the North American version. The Chinese market Regal has different front- and rear-end styling compared to the North American version and different engines, including the 2.0 L ''[[Family II engine#L34|L34]]'', the 2.5 L ''[[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#LB8|LB8]]'' V6 and the 3.0 L ''[[GM 60-Degree V6 engine#LW9|LW9]]'' V6. Gearbox choices were a 4-speed automatic for V6 models, while four-cylinder variants are paired with a 5-speed manual gearbox. V6 models had a set of black dashboard gauges, while the four-cylinder models had white dashboard gauges. These models also had slightly different names: the entry-level model was the ''New Century'', with more upscale models carrying the ''GL'' and ''GLX'' names. Later, ''G'' and ''GS'' models were added. Production for this generation ended in November 2008 in China being replaced the Opel Insignia based Regal. The Chinese-built Regal was also sold in the Philippines from 2005 to 2008 as the Chevrolet Lumina, where it replaced the [[Opel Vectra]]. {{Convert|3671|lbs|abbr=on}} (2011 CXL Turbo) | sp = us | predecessor = [[Buick LaCrosse#First generation (2005–2009)|Buick LaCrosse]] | successor = }} {{See also|Opel Insignia}} [[File:Buick (12645920815).jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal]] The fifth-generation Buick Regal is a four-door, five-passenger, [[Mid-size car|midsized]] [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]] with a [[FF layout|front engine, front-wheel drive]] layout.{{cite web |url=http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/2008car1tablef.jsp?id=30075 |title=2011 Buick Regal |year=2011 |work=fueleconomy.gov |publisher=United States Environmental Protection Agency |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4Zdiz4X?url=http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/2008car1tablef.jsp?id=30075 |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=Size Class Midsize Cars |url-status=dead }} GM says that the Regal is helping General Motors attract new, younger customers to the Buick brand. Since its launch last spring, 41 percent of Regal’s buyers have come from non-GM brands. |url-status=dead }} === Development === The fifth generation Buick Regal rides on GM's [[GM Epsilon II platform|Epsilon II]] platform and is mostly identical to the [[Opel Insignia]]. It first went into production in [[Rüsselsheim]], Germany, in 2008.{{cite web |url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/index.html |title=2011 Buick Regal |first=Todd |last=Lassa |date=November 2009 |work=motortrend.com |publisher=MotorTrend Magazine, Source Interlink Media |page=1 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4ZEcVDR?url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/specs.html |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=...GM planned to make the Opel Insignia Saturn's second-generation Aura. |url-status=dead }}{{cite web |url=http://paultan.org/2008/11/05/new-buick-regal-for-china-based-on-insignia/ |title=New Buick Regal for China based on Insignia |first=Paul |last=Tan |date=2008-11-05 |work=Paul Tan's Automotive News |publisher=Driven Media Sdn Bhd |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z2AQjmKK?url=http://paultan.org/2008/11/05/new-buick-regal-for-china-based-on-insignia/ |archivedate=2011-05-29 |accessdate=2011-05-29 |quote=The new Opel Insignia (badged as a Vauxhall in the UK) is now in China, badged as a Buick. The Insignia is wearing the Buick Regal badge... |url-status=dead }} The [[Shanghai GM]] twin of the Insignia was introduced in China as Buick Regal in December, 2008 for the 2009 model year. GM originally planned to sell a modified version of the Opel Insignia in North America as the second generation [[Saturn Aura]], but changed strategy after deciding to discontinue the [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn]] brand.{{cite web |url=http://www.autonews.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20110518/OEM04/110519901/1266 |title=Buick will get rebadged, redesigned Astra, report says |first=Rick |last=Kranz |date=2011-05-18 |work=autonews.com |publisher=Crain Communications, Inc |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z563fWtM?url=http://www.autonews.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20110518%2FOEM04%2F110519901%2F1266 |archivedate=2011-05-31 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=With Saturn's demise, Buick was selected to market a few rebadged Opel cars. For example, the current Insignia is marketed here as the Buick Regal, a key vehicle in the brand's turnaround. |url-status=dead }} The Regal utilizes [[Monocoque|unibody]] construction with [[galvanization|galvanized]] steel front fenders, hood, roof and door panels and [[Thermoplastic olefin|thermoplastic polyolefin]] (TPO) bumper covers. The North American Regal weighs about {{Convert|13|lb|0|abbr=on}} more than an equivalent Opel Insignia due to increased structural support in the [[Pillar (car)|B-pillar]] necessary to meet U.S. [[Vehicle rollover|rollover]] standards.{{cite web|url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/index.html|title=2011 Buick Regal|last=Lassa|first=Todd|date=November 2009|publisher=MotorTrend Magazine, Source Interlink Media|page=2|quote=The 2.4 comes with a GM Hydra-Matic 6T45 six-speed automatic, while the turbo comes with an Aisin AF40 six-speed automatic.|work=motortrend.com|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4VtdlaS?url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/engines.html|archivedate=2011-05-30|accessdate=2011-05-30|url-status=dead}} === Marketing === GM revealed the fifth generation Regal to North American dealers on October 14, 2009, and introduced the Regal to the public in November, 2009 at the [[LA Auto Show#2009|LA Auto Show]].{{cite press release |url=http://archives.media.gm.com/archive/documents/domain_2/docId_57405_pr.html |title=Regal Named as Next Buick Sedan |date=2010-10-04 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4e8SLa1?url=http://archives.media.gm.com/archive/documents/domain_2/docId_57405_pr.html |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=...more than 1,000 dealers this week will be the first to learn the name of Buick’s next mid-size sport sedan will be the Buick Regal. |url-status=dead }} Sales of the Regal began in February 2010. In North America, the Regal is positioned below the larger, more expensive [[Buick LaCrosse|LaCrosse]] and above the [[Buick Verano|Verano]] compact sedan which debuted late in calendar year 2011. === Production === [[File:Buick Regal CN II facelift China 2016-04-16.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal (China - facelift)]] Production of the [[Shanghai GM]] variant of the Regal began in November 2008 and ended in July 2017. North American production at [[General Motors of Canada]]'s [[Oshawa, Ontario]], assembly plant was confirmed on November 25, 2009, and production began at [[Oshawa Car Assembly]] in February 2011. The initial production for the North American market was done together with its Opel twin the [[Opel Insignia]] in the [[Adam Opel AG]]'s [[Rüsselsheim]], Germany assembly plant from March 1, 2010 to March 25, 2011 (33,669 cars in 2010 and 12,637 in 2011).Production period according to a Foto on display at the Opel plant as seen on September 22, 2012, during the Open House on occasion of the 150-year Opel jubilee === Trim levels === ==== {{anchor|CXL and CXL Turbo}} CXL ==== The Regal debuted in North America with a single engine, the 2.4L DOHC I4 engine and was rated at {{Convert|182|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|172|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque. The 2.4L engine is mated to a GM [[Hydramatic|Hydra-Matic]] 6T45 six-speed The 2011 Regal produced in North America was offered in one trim level, called CXL, and was offered with two engine choices and seven option packages. Buick had planned to offer a lower-level trim called CX with cloth seats and a higher level trim called CXS, but those trim levels have not yet been offered.{{cite web |url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/future_plans.html |title=2011 Buick Regal |first=Todd |last=Lassa |date=November 2009 |work=motortrend.com |publisher=MotorTrend Magazine, Source Interlink Media |page=3 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4YVbINn?url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/sedans/112_0911_2011_buick_regal/future_plans.html |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=...Buick will add base, cloth-seat CX and high-zoot CXS trim levels. |url-status=dead }} ==== CXL Turbo ==== The CXL Turbo comes equipped with a [[turbocharger|turbocharged]] 2.0L direct-injected [[GM Ecotec engine|Ecotec]] DOHC I4 rated at {{Convert|220|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|258|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque, mated to either an [[Aisin Seiki Co.#Aisin AW|Aisin]] [[AWTF-80 SC|AF40]] 6-speed automatic or a 6-speed [[manual transmission]], making the Regal Turbo the first Buick model to be offered with a manual transmission since the [[Buick Skyhawk]] ended production in 1989. The 2.0L turbo is the first direct-injected turbocharged production car capable of running on any blend of gasoline or E85 ethanol.{{cite press release |url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/0221_regalturbo |title=Buick Regal Turbo Gets Industry-First Turbo Direct-Injected Engine with Flex-Fuel Capability |date=2011-02-21 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4gcFkpx?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/0221_regalturbo |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=The 2011 Buick Regal Turbo is the first direct-injected turbocharged production car capable of running on any blend of gasoline or E85 ethanol... |url-status=dead }} ==== GS ==== [[File:2011 Buick Verano (5490346021).jpg|thumb|left|2011 Buick Regal GS]] At the [[North American International Auto Show#2010|2010 North American International Auto Show]] in Detroit, GM showed a concept GS version of the Regal based on the Opel Insignia [[Opel Performance Center|OPC]] and the Vauxhall Insignia VXR. The concept featured a 2.0L, {{convert|270|hp|0|abbr=on}}, {{convert|295|lbft|abbr=on}} high-output DOHC I4 turbocharged Ecotec engine, a 6-speed manual transmission and all-wheel drive. The production GS leaves most of the concept specifications intact, but is front-wheel drive. The GS features Buick's Interactive Drive Control System with GS mode, a choice of an FGP Germany F40-6 six-speed manual or Aisin AF-40 (G2) six-speed automatic transmission, high performance brakes with [[Brembo]] front calipers and high performance strut (HiPerStrut) front suspension. 19 inch wheels will be standard and 20 inch forged aluminum wheels will be available. The GS is expected to accelerate from 0 to 60 mph (97 km/h) in under 7 seconds. The production version is equipped with GS-only high-output version of the Ecotec 2.0L turbo engine with {{Convert|270|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|295|lbft|abbr=on}} of torque. The GM LHU engine used in the GS trim makes 135 hp per liter - Buick’s highest specific output ever.{{cite web |last=Harman |first=Dan |title=Buick Regal |date=2014-02-05 |url=http://www.mojomotors.com/review/buick-regal/ |publisher=Mojo Motors |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6NA6CL8No?url=http://www.mojomotors.com/review/buick-regal/ |archivedate=2014-02-05 |accessdate=2014-02-05 |url-status=dead }} The GS went on sale in fall 2011 as a 2012 model.{{cite press release|title=Buick Regal GS Production Model Takes Sports Sedan Performance To A New Level For Buick|date=2010-11-04|publisher=General Motors Company|url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/news/news_detail.brand_gm.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Nov/1104_gm_regal_gs|quote=Body style/driveline: four-door, five-passenger, front-engine transaxle. Front-wheel drive midsize sedan|accessdate=2011-05-30|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4bTpn44?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/news/news_detail.brand_gm.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2010/Nov/1104_gm_regal_gs|archivedate=2011-05-30|url-status=dead}}{{cite web |url=http://www.caranddriver.com/features/10q1/2012_buick_regal_gs-feature |title=2012 Buick Regal GS - Feature |date=April 2010 |work=caranddriver.com |publisher=Hachette Filipacchi Media U.S., Inc |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4cOkeJx?url=http://www.caranddriver.com/features/10q1/2012_buick_regal_gs-feature |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=While Europeans will get an Insignia OPC with a {{Convert|325|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}, turbocharged V-6, the GS gets a higher-output version of the 2.0-liter turbo four found in the Regal. |url-status=dead }} The [[Shanghai GM]] variant of Regal GS went on sale in China on September 15, 2011. This car has been localized. The output of the 2.0L Turbo SIDI engine is {{Convert|162|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}}, which is about {{Convert|40|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} less than the production US-model. The torque is {{convert|350|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}}. and the top speed is claimed as {{convert|232|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}. The car is only offered in this case as a front-wheel-drive. There exist also some interior and exterior differences between the American and Chinese models.{{cite web |url=http://www.buick.com.cn/RegalGS/ |title=2015款新君威GS 焕新登场 |publisher=Buick China |language=Chinese |date= |accessdate=2015-03-21}}{{cite web | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120131073541/http://buick.com.cn/RegalGS/specifications.aspx | url=http://www.buick.com.cn/RegalGS/specifications.aspx |title=别克官方网站--君威GS·智驱豹-价格配置 |publisher=Buick China | archivedate = 2012-01-31 | date= September 2011 | language=Chinese}} ==== Sport Touring Edition ==== For 2016, the Regal added a new Sport Touring Edition which included unique 18" aluminum black pocket wheels and a rear lip spoiler. ==== eAssist ==== [[File:2012 Buick Regal eAssist WAS 2012 0830.JPG|thumb|2012 Buick Regal with optional [[BAS Hybrid#Generation II BAS (eAssist)|eAssist]] hybrid system]] Beginning in 2011, Buick began offering the [[BAS Hybrid#Generation II BAS (eAssist)|eAssist]] system in the Regal, The 2012 [[model year]] Regal is the second GM vehicle to offer eAssist after the 2012 [[Buick LaCrosse]]. The eAssist system is standard in the LaCrosse, but the eAssist powertrain is optional in the Regal. The eAssist system adds a lithium-ion battery housed in the trunk, along with regenerative braking, engine stop/start, fuel cut-off, grille louvres that close at speed, underbody panels and low-rolling resistance tires. The eAssist system adds up to {{convert|15|hp|kW|abbr=on}} to the standard 2.4L Ecotec engine during acceleration. Fuel economy for the Regal with eAssist is estimated at {{convert|26|mpgus|abbr=on}} city, {{convert|37|mpgus|abbr=on}} highway.{{cite press release |url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/11chicago/buick/0208_Regal_eA |title=2012 Regal to Offer New eAssist™ Fuel-Saving Technology |date=2011-02-08 |publisher=General Motors Company |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5z4n9b1i5?url=http://media.gm.com/content/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2011/Feb/11chicago/buick/0208_Regal_eA |archivedate=2011-05-30 |accessdate=2011-05-30 |quote=Mated to Regal’s 2.4L Ecotec direct injection four-cylinder engine and next-generation six-speed automatic transmission... |url-status=dead }} === 2014 Update === [[File:2014 Regal.JPG|thumb|2014 Buick Regal eAssist]] GM revealed an updated 2014 Regal at the [[New York Auto Show#2013|2013 New York Auto Show]]. Changes include a revised interior and exterior, a boost in performance for the CXL Turbo up to 258 hp (192 kW) and 295 lb·ft (400 N·m) of torque, and an available all-wheel drive option offered for the 2.0L engine/6-speed automatic transmission equipped vehicles. Changes for the GS include revised interior and exterior, a drop in power to match that of the CXL Turbo, and available an all-wheel drive option offered for the 2.0L / six-speed automatic transmission equipped vehicles. The six-speed manual transmission is still offered, but only in the front-wheel drive variant. Buick's [[Buick#VentiPorts|VentiPorts]] have reappeared starting with 2014 models, a styling feature unique to Buick that dates back to 1949. Several new safety features were added for the 2014 year, which include forward collision warning, lane-departure warning, blind-spot monitoring, rear cross-traffic alert, and a following-distance indicator. Buick Regal began sales in China on July 21, 2017.[http://media.gm.com/media/cn/en/buick/vehicles/All-New-Buick-Regal/2017.html "All-New Buick Regal"], ''Buick News China'', Retrieved on 16 August 2017. Similar to the previous generation, it is related to the [[Opel Insignia|Opel and Vauxhall Insignia]] sold in Europe and [[Holden Commodore (ZB)|Holden ZB Commodore]] in Australia, and like the previous generation, the vehicles were developed and are produced by Opel in Germany. ===Regal Sportback=== The [[fastback]] version of the Regal, now branded as Regal Sportback, is the replacement for the Regal sedan. While the roofline is similar to that of its predecessor, the new liftback configuration provides added utility. It has grown larger in size, and is around {{Convert|300-500|lb|0|abbr=on}} lighter than the previous Regal.{{cite web|title=2017 Buick Regal Will Be Lighter, Longer Than Current Model|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/2015/07/2017-buick-regal-will-be-lighter-longer-than-current-model/|last=Singer|first=Drew|website=GM Authority|date=July 30, 2016|accessdate=August 6, 2016}} It carries two versions of the ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LTG|LTG]]'' 2.0 L [[Turbocharged]] [[inline-4]] engine. [[Front-wheel drive]] models produce {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} at 5400 rpm and {{convert|260|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 2000 rpm, while the [[all-wheel drive]] model produces {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} at 5500 and {{convert|295|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 3000 rpm, respectively.{{cite web|title=2018 Buick Regal spy shots|url=http://www.motorauthority.com/news/1102584_2018-buick-regal-spy-shots|last=Vijayenthiran|first=Viknesh|website=Motor Authority|date=February 27, 2016|accessdate=August 6, 2016}} ===Regal TourX=== [[File:Buick Regal TourX.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal TourX]] [[File:Buick Regal TourX rear.jpg|thumb|left|Rear view]] The station wagon variant, named Regal TourX, was also introduced and went on sale at the same time as the hatchback, marking the first time since the demise of the [[Buick Roadmaster|Roadmaster]] in 1996 that Buick had a station wagon in its lineup. The TourX competes against the [[Volvo V60 Cross Country]], [[Audi A4 Allroad]], [[Subaru Outback]], and [[BMW 3 Series (F30)|BMW 3 Series wagon]], and offers up to 73.5 cubic feet of storage space behind the front seats, but only comes in all-wheel drive, along with a ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LTG|LTG]]'' turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder producing an estimated {{convert|250|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|295|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} mated with an eight-speed automatic transmission. ===GS=== [[File:Buick Regal II GS 001.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal GS sedan, front (China)]] [[File:Buick Regal II GS 002.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Regal GS sedan, rear (China)]] The 2018 GS is the performance version of sixth generation Regal. This generation of GS sports a 3.6 liter [[GM High Feature engine|LGX]] V6 engine producing 310 hp. ===Discontinuation=== In December 2019, General Motors announced that it would end production of the Buick Regal for [[North America]] following the 2020 [[model year]], citing the popularity of the brand's [[sport utility vehicle]]s (SUV's), which have contributed to declining sales of Buick's passenger cars. However, despite the discontinuation of the Regal in [[North America]], Buick will continue to produce the Regal for the [[China|Chinese]] market, where the vehicle recently received a mid-cycle facelift.https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/cars/2019/12/04/buick-regal-discontinued-gm-general-motors/2607182001/ {{clear}} == Sales == {| class="wikitable" |- ! It is available in front wheel drive (FWD) and all wheel drive (AWD) versions. The 2013 through 2015 Buick Encore was offered in Base, Convenience, Leather, and Premium level models with the A14NET 1.4 litre inline four cylinder multi port fuel injected (MFI) VVT turbo gasoline engine rated at 138 hp @ 4900 rpm coupled to a six speed automatic transmission. For 2016, a new Sport Touring second tier model was added which included unique 18" aluminium alloy wheels with midnight silver finish, rear spoiler, body color door handles, remote start, fog lamps, and a new more powerful GM B14XFT Ecotec inline four cylinder direct fuel injection (DI) VVT engine rated at 153 hp @ 5600 rpm in the Buick Encore literature. However, Opel rates the engine at 112 kW (150 hp) @ 4900-6000 rpm. The second-generation Encore will not be exported to North America, because it uses the GEM platform intended for "emerging" markets. The first-generation Encore will continue to be sold in North America instead. The larger Buick Encore GX will be added to both the Chinese, Mexican,https://noticias.autocosmos.com.mx/2019/09/24/buick-encore-gx-2020-estara-disponible-en-mexico-a-inicios-del-ano-que-viene and North American markets in 2020. General Motors of Mexico announced to launch the new generation to replace the smaller Mokka-based model for Mexico in early 2020 to place itself between the [[Buick Enclave|Enclave]] and [[Buick Envision|Envision]], and will carry the GX nameplate just like it will in North America. Although mechanical specifications in the market are not confirmed, it will either come with two motors, a 3-cylinder 137hp 1.2-litre motor with CVT gearbox and frontal traction, or a turbocharged motor with 155 hp, 9-speed gearbox and AWD. In terms of equipment, Buick has confirmed that the Encore GX will come with a robust list of equipment, with Bose 7-speaker audio system with subwoofer, 8" infotainment screen, induction charger, QuietTuning audio cancellation system, and an Onstar 4G LTE system with a maximum connection to 7 devices. [[Opel Astra#Saturn Astra|Saturn Astra]] | successor = }} The '''Buick Verano''' is a [[FF layout|front engine, front-wheel drive layout]], four-door, five passenger, [[luxury vehicle|entry-level luxury]]{{cite web|url=http://www.caranddriver.com/buick/verano|title=Buick Verano Review|work=Car and Driver|accessdate=2016-03-13}} [[compact car]] manufactured by [[General Motors]] for its [[Buick]] brand at the [[Orion Assembly]] plant in [[Orion Township, Michigan]], and in China by GM's Joint Venture with [[SAIC Motor]], [[SAIC-GM]] (also called Shanghai GM). The Verano debuted at the [[North American International Auto Show]] on January 10, 2011, during a preview of Buick's then upcoming 2012 model.{{Sfn|General Motors Company|2011}}{{Sfn|Lienert|2010}}{{Sfn|Jacquot|2011}}{{Sfn|Smith|2011}} It is the first compact marketed by [[Buick]] in the United States since the 1998 [[Buick Skylark]]. ''Verano'' is Spanish for summer.{{Sfn|Ulrich|2011}} The Verano—along with the [[Buick Excelle GT]],{{Sfn|Kranz|2011}} which was developed for the Chinese market and produced in China and the [[Opel Astra]]/[[Vauxhall Astra]] sedan, which was presented at the 2012 [[Moscow International Automobile Salon]]—shares [[General Motors]]' [[GM Delta II platform|Delta II]] platform with the [[Chevrolet Cruze]] and the corresponding MPV models, [[Chevrolet Orlando]] and [[Opel Zafira|Opel/Vauxhall Zafira Tourer]]. __TOC__ {{clear}} == First generation (2012–2017) == {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | image = 2012 Buick Verano -- 04-30-2012.JPG | caption = | aka = [[Buick Excelle GT]] (China)
[[Opel Astra]]/[[Vauxhall Astra]]/[[Holden Astra]] | production = 2010–2015 (China)
2011–2016 (United States) | model_years = 2012–2017 | assembly = United States: [[Orion Township, Michigan]] ([[Orion Assembly]])
China: [[Shanghai]] (as Excelle GT) | designer = David Lyon | body_style = 4-door [[Sedan (car)|sedan]] | platform = [[GM Delta II platform|Delta II platform]] | related = [[Buick Excelle XT]]
[[Chevrolet Cruze]]
[[Chevrolet Orlando]]

[[Holden Astra]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel drive]] | engine = {{unbulleted list |2.4 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LEA|LEA]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[gasoline]]/[[E85]])|2.0 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LHU|LHU]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|turbocharged]] gasoline)|1.5 L ''[[GM small gasoline engine#LFV|LFV]]'' [[Inline-four engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|turbocharged]] gasoline)}} | transmission = {{unbulleted list |6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|GM 6T40]]'' [[automatic transmission|automatic]]|6-speed ''[[GM 6T40 transmission|GM 6T50]]'' [[automatic transmission|automatic]]|6-speed ''[[GM F40|GM F40-6]]'' [[manual transmission|manual]]|7-speed [[dual-clutch transmission|dual-clutch]]}} | wheelbase = {{convert|105.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|183.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|71.4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|58.4|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|3300|lbs|kg|abbr=on}} | sp = us | successor = }} Jim Federico, Executive Director and Vehicle Chief Engineer for Verano, led the vehicle development team and David Lyon, Buick design director, styled the exterior.{{Sfn|Schwegman|Federico|2011}}{{Sfn|Lassa|2011}} The Verano is essentially a North American-market version of the Chinese-market compact [[Buick Excelle GT]]. The Verano's unibody construction uses galvanized steel for its front fenders, hood, roof and door panels and [[Thermoplastic olefin|thermoplastic polyolefin]] (TPO) bumper covers.{{Sfn|General Motors Company|2011}} It incorporates acoustical laminated glass, triple door seals, a five-layer interior roof liner, sound absorbing mats, recycled denim insulation and specially manufactured 18-inch forged alloy wheels, which minimize road noise.{{Sfn|General Motors Company|2011}} Buick's [[Buick#VentiPorts|VentiPorts]] reappeared at the Verano's introduction, a styling feature unique to Buick dating back to 1949. [[File:2013 Buick Verano 2.4 rear.jpg|thumb|left|Rear view]] [[File:Buick Excelle GT 02 China 2012-05-20.JPG|thumb|left|Buick Excelle GT (China)]] The standard powertrain is a 2.4 L [[GM Ecotec engine#LEA|Ecotec]] [[Fuel injection#Direct injection|direct-injected]] DOHC [[Inline-four engine|I4]] mated to a six-speed [[automatic transmission]]. The 2.4 L engine is rated {{convert|180|hp|kW}} at 6,700 rpm and {{convert|171|ftlb|Nm|0|abbr=on}} of torque at 4,900 rpm. The engine is flex-fuel capable, meaning it can use either gasoline, or E85 ethanol (2012-13)http://www.cleanairchoice.org/fuels/e85_vehicles.cfm • 2.4L, or any combination of the two fuels. EPA fuel economy estimates are {{convert|21|mpgus|l/100 km}} city and {{convert|32|mpgus|l/100 km}} highway for gasoline.http://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/Find.do?action=sbs&id=32160{{Sfn|General Motors Company|2011}} A 2012 [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i6tok5np8G4 on-road mixed highway-city review] by the website MPGOMATIC showed an average 26.5 MPG on E85, and 29 for gasoline. A 2.0 L turbocharged version became available in late 2012, for the 2013 model year, as did a 6-speed [[manual transmission]]. The 2.0 L turbo engine is rated at 250 horsepower and 260 lb-ft of torque. GM estimated acceleration from 0-60 mph is 6.2 seconds, matching the number posted by the [[Buick Regal]] GS.{{cite web |url=http://media.gm.com/media/us/en/gm/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/us/en/2012/Jun/0611_verano_turbo.html |title=2013 Buick Verano Turbo Debuts with 250 Horsepower|accessdate=2012-06-13 |author=General Motors |date=2012-06-12 |publisher=GM Media Online }} For 2016, the Verano added a new Sport Touring Edition which included unique 18″ aluminum black pocket wheels and a rear lip spoiler. The Verano was phased out from the US market after the 2017 model year. The second generation Verano is sold exclusively in China,{{cite news|last1=Weiner|first1=Eric|title=Buick Verano Canceled for U.S. after 2017, Says Report|url=http://www.automobilemag.com/news/buick-verano-canceled-u-s-2017-says-report/|accessdate=9 May 2016|work=Automobile magazine|date=9 May 2016}} leaving Buick without an entry-level sedan in the US market. {{clear}} === Engines === {| class="wikitable" cellpadding="0" style="text-align:center; font-size:91%; width:100%;" |- !colspan="8"|Petrol engine |- style="background:#dcdcdc; text-align:center; vertical-align:middle;" !Engine !Displacement !Power !Torque !Transmission !Model Years |- style="background:#fff;" |- style="background:#fff;" |'''2.4 L [[GM Ecotec engine#LEA|Ecotec]] [[Inline-four engine|I4]] (Flex-Fuel)'''||2384 cc||180 DIN at 6700 rpm||{{convert|171|ftlb|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 4900 rpm||6-speed [[automatic transmission|automatic]] ||2012- |-style="background:#fff;" |'''2.0 L [[GM Ecotec engine#LEA|Ecotec]] t/c [[Inline-four engine|I4]]'''|| 1998 cc||250 DIN at 5300 rpm||{{convert|260|ftlb|Nm|0|abbr=on}} at 2000 rpm||6-speed [[automatic transmission|automatic]]

[[Buick Excelle GX]] | designer = Yin He | sp = us }} The second generation Verano was introduced on 27 July 2015 in the Chinese market.{{cite news|last1=Capparella|first1=Joseph|title=2016 Buick Verano Debuts in Chinese-Market Form in Shanghai|url=http://www.automobilemag.com/news/2016-buick-verano-debuts-in-chinese-market-form-in-shanghai/|accessdate=12 May 2016|work=Automobile magazine|date=20 April 2015}}{{cite web |url= http://www.buick.com.cn/verano/newsdetails.aspx?id=287 |title= SAIC-GM announced Buick new generation of Verano |author= |date= 8 June 2015 |website= Buick Official Website |publisher= SAIC-GM |access-date= 14 May 2016 |url-status= dead |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160522104716/http://www.buick.com.cn/verano/newsdetails.aspx?id=287 |archivedate= 22 May 2016 }} This Verano is longer but significantly lighter, more fuel efficient and has more interior space than its predecessor. It is sold in both sedan and hatchback body styles.{{cite web|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/gm/buick/verano/2017-verano/|title=2017 Buick Verano|accessdate=2015-11-07|publisher=GM Authority}} === Verano GS === [[File:Buick Verano II hatch GS 01 China 2016-03-28.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Verano GS hatchback]] A high-performance [[Buick Gran Sport|GS]] variant based on the upcoming [[Opel Astra#Astra K (2015–present)|Opel Astra OPC]] made its introduction at the 2015 Guangzhou Auto Show on November 20, 2015, and went on sale in China at the end of the year. Available in hatchback form, the Verano GS is powered by a turbocharged 1.5 liter [[inline-4]] rated at 167 horsepower{{cite web|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/gm/buick/verano/2017-verano/2017-verano-gs/|title=2017 Buick Verano GS|accessdate=2015-11-07|publisher=GM Authority}} mated with a 7-speed dual-clutch gearbox exclusive to the model. Unique aesthetic features include red accents and black chrome wheels.{{cite web|url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/2015/11/2016-buick-verano-gs-leaked-ahead-of-official-reveal/|title=2017 Buick Verano GS|accessdate=2015-11-07|author=Sean Szymkowski|date=2015-11-06|publisher=GM Authority}} === 2018 facelift === In late 2017, Buick announced a facelift update for the 2018 model year that adds the new Buick grilles with the spreading wings to the Verano and Excelle products. The update applies to the Buick Verano sedan, Buick Verano hatchback, Buick Excelle GT sedan, and added a Buick Excelle GX station wagon as an additional new body style. [[Pontiac Torrent]] }} The '''Buick Envision''' is a compact [[Crossover (automobile)|crossover SUV]] built by [[SAIC-GM]]. ==Background== The Envision was first introduced publicly in China on July 1, 2014, with a photo of the car under a cover and placed between a [[Buick Encore]] and a [[Buick Enclave]]. On July 21, some specifications and the first official photos, as well as its Chinese name “Ang Ke Wei” (昂科威), were made public. The car is produced in China by [[SAIC-GM]] and went on sale in late 2014.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} By 2016, the Envision was available in China, the United States, Canada, and Mexico.{{cite web |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/americans-embrace-a-made-in-china-buick-suv-1475771438 | title=Americans Embrace a Made-in-China Buick SUV | date=October 6, 2016 | access-date=October 6, 2016}}{{cite web | url=http://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/general-motors/2015/08/18/uaw-buick-envision/31912469/ | title=UAW to address possible China-made Buick import | date=August 18, 2015 | access-date=August 19, 2015}}{{cite web | url=http://blog.caranddriver.com/buick-envision-cuv-almost-definitely-coming-to-u-s-plus-a-subcompact-hatch-too/ | title=Buick Envision CUV Almost Definitely Coming to U.S.—Plus a Subcompact Hatch, Too? | date=July 24, 2015 | access-date=August 19, 2015}} In addition to the larger engines offered in North America, Chinese buyers also have the option of a turbocharged 1.5-liter unit. The Envision made its U.S. debut at the [[North American International Auto Show]] on January 11, 2016, as a compact CUV,[http://www.autoblog.com/2016/01/11/2016-buick-envision-detroit-2016/ "2016 Buick Envision might be your first Chinese-built crossover"] from Autoblog (January 11, 2016) sharing the segment with a second generation [[GMC Terrain]] and the [[Chevrolet Equinox]].[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2016/01/2016-buick-envision-will-be-all-wheel-drive-only/ "2016 Buick Envision Will Be All Wheel Drive Only"] from GM Authority (January 9, 2016) It went on sale in the United States in the summer of 2016, making it the first Chinese-built GM vehicle to be sold in America.[http://www.autoblog.com/2015/12/04/buick-envision-cuv-china-confirmed/ "Buick confirms US-market Envision CUV to be built in China"] from Autoblog (December 4, 2015) It was initially only offered in all-wheel drive, but front wheel drive became an option starting in the 2017 model year. The North American version of the Envision features two powertrains: a 2.5L LCV four-cylinder with {{convert|197|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|192|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}} and a turbo-charged 2.0L LTG four-cylinder engine SAE certified at {{convert|252|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|260|lbft|Nm|0|abbr=on}}, paired with a third-generation six-speed transmission, seven active safety technologies, and OnStar/Intellilink connectivity. For the 2016 model year, it was only available in Premium I and Premium II trim levels.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/gm/buick/envision/2016-envision/ 2016 Buick Envision] from GM Authority (March 28, 2016) The trim levels expanded to five for the 2017 model year, with the base level Envision starting at US$34,990.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2016/04/2017-buick-envision-to-start-at-34990/ "2017 Buick Envision To Start at $34,990"] from GM Authority (April 11, 2016) File:2016 Buick Envision, front right.jpg|Buick Envision pre-facelift front view. File:2016 Buick Envision, rear right.jpg|Buick Envision pre-facelift rear view. ===2019 facelift=== Debuted in late 2017 in China, and revealed in 2018 for North American market, the 2019 Envision features an updated exterior that now falls more in line with Buick design themes across the rest of the lineup. The updated model has improved seating, a change in the grille that follows Buick’s American winged/waterfall models, a more chiseled design at the rear end, angular tail lights, and a newly calibrated stop/start feature.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/02/2019-buick-envision-bows-with-updated-looks-and-customer-focused-improvements/ “2019 Buick Envision Bows With Updated Looks And Customer Focused Improvements”] from GM Authority (February 26, 2018) The 2019 Envision has a starting price of US$32,990 in the U.S. market. Buick Envision facelift.jpg|Buick Envision post-facelift front view. Buick Envision facelift 2.jpg|Buick Envision post-facelift rear view. ==Controversy== The announcement about selling the Chinese-built vehicle to American consumers has drawn a backlash from the United Auto Workers, who had just finalized a contract agreement with GM and had wanted the automaker to build the Envision stateside: “Today’s announcement by General Motors that they are importing the Envision from China is a slap in the face to U.S. taxpayers and the men and women who worked so hard to save GM during its darkest time,” UAW President Dennis Williams and Vice President Cindy Estrada, who head the GM department for the union, said in a joint statement on December 4, 2015. On the other hand, Buick spokesman Stuart Fowle defended the decision to keep production in China and import it rather than having it built in the United States because it made sense from a business point of view: “We have production already going (in China) and adding a second manufacturing facility for the volumes that we would expect in the U.S. just wasn’t feasible,” he said. “We wanted to take advantage of the manufacturing already in place. We’re very confident in the vehicle.”{{cite web | url=http://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/general-motors/2015/12/04/buick-envision/76795170/ | title=Buick Envision made in China headed to U.S. next summer | date=December 5, 2015 | access-date=December 5, 2015}} On August 6, 2018, General Motors announced that it might withdraw the Envision from the United States market, should a request to seek a waiver to continue to import the vehicle is denied. GM is seeking the waiver amid a trade war between the United States and China over tariffs that could hurt the sales of the Envision. The automaker sees the potential exemption as “the only way” to continue offering the vehicle to U.S. consumers, according to GM President [[Dan Ammann]].[http://www.autonews.com/article/20180803/RETAIL/180809889/gm-seeks-tariff-exemption-buck-envision "Buick could pull Envision from U.S. without tariff exemption"] from Automotive News (August 6, 2018) The exemption was denied on May 29, 2019, but GM has opted to pay the tariffs without raising the price on the vehicle for the time being. Buick is confident that ongoing talks between China and the United States could spare the Envision's future in North America.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/06/us-denies-gm-exemption-on-tariffs-for-china-made-buick-envision/ "US Denies GM Exemption On Tariffs For China-Made Buick Envision"] from GM Authority (June 5, 2019)[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/06/buick-envision-may-be-spared-as-china-trade-deal-nears/ "Buick Envision May Be Spared As China Trade Deal Nears"] from GM Authority (June 28, 2019) == Reception== In 2017, the Envision was Buick's third bestselling model in the U.S. with sales of just over 41,000 units. Sales in the U.S. dropped 27% in 2018 but rebounded slightly in 2019. == Sales == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Calendar year ! United States !! [[Pontiac Montana SV6]] }} The '''Buick Enclave''' is a [[mid-size]]{{cite web|url=http://www.buick.com/suvs/enclave-mid-size-luxury-suv|title=Buick enclave size|accessdate=February 16, 2018|date=2017}} [[crossover SUV]] launched in 2008. The Enclave, the Saturn Outlook, the [[GMC Acadia]], and [[Chevrolet Traverse]] all share the [[GM Lambda platform]]. The Enclave was previewed at the [[North American International Auto Show#2006|2006 North American International Auto Show]],{{cite web|url=http://autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20060108/FREE/60108006/1024/LATESTNEWS|title=Buick shows off Enclave crossover concept; production version due in '07|work=[[AutoWeek]]|date=January 8, 2006|accessdate=January 9, 2006|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929092951/http://autoweek.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20060108%2FFREE%2F60108006%2F1024%2FLATESTNEWS|archive-date=September 29, 2007|url-status=dead}} officially as a [[concept car]], making it the first Lambda vehicle to be displayed. The Enclave is partially based on the [[Buick Centieme]] concept shown at the 2003 Detroit Auto Show. The Enclave replaced both of Buick's SUVs, the minivan-based [[Buick Rendezvous|Rendezvous]] and the truck-based [[Buick Rainier|Rainier]], as well as the [[Buick Terraza|Terraza]] [[minivan]]. As of February 2014, the 2014 Enclave was the top-ranked Affordable Midsize SUV in U.S. News & World Report's rankings.{{cite web |url=http://usnews.rankingsandreviews.com/cars-trucks/rankings/Affordable-Midsize-SUVs/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-10-25 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101124201709/http://usnews.rankingsandreviews.com/cars-trucks/rankings/Affordable-Midsize-SUVs/ |archivedate=2010-11-24 }} The second-generation Enclave was officially revealed at the 2017 [[New York Auto Show]].http://www.autonews.com/article/20170221/OEM04/170229977/buick-enclave-grows-more-muscular-for-2018 __TOC__ {{clear}} == {{Anchor|1}}First generation (2008–2017) == {{Infobox automobile |name = First generation |image = Buick Enclave.jpg |model_years = 2008–2017 |production = April 11, 2007–2017 |assembly = [[Lansing Delta Township Assembly]],

{{convert|71.7|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} (2013–2017) |wheelbase = {{convert|118.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} |weight = {{convert|4780-4985|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}} |platform = [[GM Lambda platform]] }} === Features === [[File:Buick Enclave rear China 2012-05-12.JPG|thumb|left|Rear view]] The Enclave has seating for seven passengers, with an optional second row bench seat instead of the standard two captain chairs which increases the seating to eight. It comes standard with [[front wheel drive|front-wheel drive]] with an option of [[all wheel drive|all-wheel drive]]. The Enclave shares powertrains with its Lambda siblings. For its first year of production, the Enclave was powered by a {{Convert|275|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} 3.6 L [[GM High Feature engine#LY7|High Feature]] [[V6 engine]] mated to a six-speed [[automatic transmission]].{{cite web|url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/suvs/112_0708_2008_buick_enclave |author=Lassa, Todd |title=2008 Buick Enclave – First Drive |work=Motor Trend |date=May 29, 2007 |accessdate=October 28, 2007}} For the 2009 model, an upgraded power boost for the 3.6 L V6 [[Spark Ignition Direct Injection]] VVT is now at {{convert|288|hp|abbr=on}} and {{convert|270|lb·ft|0|abbr=on}} of torque standard (also standard on other 2009 Lambdas). The latter direct-injection engine offers a broader torque curve, and brings fuel economy to {{convert|17|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}}/{{convert|24|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} for FWD models and {{convert|16|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}}/{{convert|22|mpgus|L/100 km mpgimp|abbr=on}} for AWD models, according to the new [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] estimates. The Lambda vehicles are built at [[General Motors|GM]]'s new [[Delta Township Assembly]] plant near [[Lansing, Michigan]], and production of the Enclave commenced on April 11, 2007,{{cite web |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2007/04/11/canadians-get-out-your-wallets-buick-sets-pricing-for-enclave/ |author=Tutor, Chris |title=Canadians, get out your wallets: Buick sets pricing for Enclave |work=Autoblog |date=April 11, 2007 |accessdate=2009-12-23}} with the first vehicles reaching certain dealers by the end of the month. The Enclave debuted with a starting price of $32,790. The Enclave is often praised for its subsequently vast cargo space while maintaining the relatively dynamic nature of unibody construction over the conventional [[body-on-frame]]. It is also praised for being one of the quietest vehicles available for sale in the United States, as well as for the quality of the interior.{{cite web|url=http://www.edmunds.com/buick/enclave/2009/review.html|title=2009 Buick Enclave Review|accessdate=2009-03-08|work=edmunds.com}} In its first year of production, the Enclave was often criticized for its 6-speed transmission, which was "hesitant to downshift." For 2009, though, the powertrain is regarded as more competent with more abundant torque. For its entire production, it has been regarded as too heavy, weighing nearly {{convert|5000|lb}} with all-wheel-drive. Buick's [[Buick#VentiPorts|VentiPorts]] have reappeared at the Enclave's introduction, a styling feature unique to Buick dating back to 1949. Initial sales of the Enclave have been very strong, with demand far exceeding production capacity, forcing GM to add a third shift to the Delta Township plant. With the arrival of the [[Buick Envision]] (which is slotted between the Enclave and [[Buick Encore]]) to North America in 2016 (for the 2017 model year), the Enclave will be bigger after Envision's debut, and the 2017 model year Enclave will be the last under the first generation platform. === 2013 facelift === [[File:Buick Enclave facelift China 2018-03-20.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Enclave]] GM unveiled the 2013 Buick Enclave on April 3, 2012, one day before its official debut at the [[New York Auto Show]].{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2012/04/03/2013-buick-enclave-debuts-with-new-look-over-same-drivetrain/|title=2013 Buick Enclave debuts with new look over same drivetrain|accessdate=2012-04-03}} The 2013 model features revised exterior styling including a new chrome waterfall grille, xenon headlights with [[LED]] running lights, LED Foglights, and LED taillights.{{cite web | url = http://www.bestcarsguide.com/2013-buick-enclave-lightning-technology/ | title = 2013 Buick Enclave Lightning Technology | publisher = BestCarsGuide | editor-first = Arman | editor-last = Barari }} Interior updates include a redesigned dashboard with more soft-touch materials, wood and chrome accents, blue ambient lighting, and touchscreen [[MyLink|IntelliLink]] infotainment display. Among safety features are seven standard airbags, including an industry-first front center airbag, and available blind-spot monitoring.{{cite web|url=http://www.buick.com/2013-enclave-luxury-crossover-suv.html|title=2013 Buick Enclave|accessdate=2012-04-03|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407035657/http://www.buick.com/2013-enclave-luxury-crossover-suv.html|archivedate=2012-04-07}} === Markets === Sales in the United States and Canada began in 2007 during the 2008 model year. In 2008, General Motors began exporting the Enclave to [[People's Republic of China|China]], to be sold through [[Shanghai GM]]'s Buick network.{{cite web |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2008/07/29/buick-enclave-gets-passport-for-sale-in-china/ |title=Buick Enclave gets passport for sale in China |author=Jeremy Korzeniewski |work=AutoBlog |date=July 29, 2008 |accessdate=2009-11-10}} The Buick brand has been relaunched in Mexico for the 2010 model year, bringing the Enclave to that market.{{cite web |url=http://www.insideline.com/buick/lacrosse/2010/buick-prepares-return-to-mexico.html |title=Buick Prepares Return to Mexico |author=Loriana Marietta |work=Edmunds Inside Line |date=August 26, 2009 |accessdate=2009-11-19}} {{Clear}} == {{Anchor|2}}Second generation (2018–present) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = 2019 Buick Enclave 3.6L, front 8.25.19.jpg | production = 2017–present | model_years = 2018–present | assembly = [[Lansing Delta Township Assembly]],
