[[Cadillac XT6#1|Cadillac XT6]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Transverse front-engine, front-wheel drive]] / [[Front-engine, all-wheel-drive layout|all-wheel drive]] | engine = 3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LFY|LFY]]'' [[V6 engine|V6]] (gasoline){{cite web |url=http://gmauthority.com/blog/gm/buick/enclave/2018-buick-enclave/|title=2018 Buick Enclave|work=GM Authority|accessdate=2017-06-15}} | transmission = GM 9-speed 9T65 [[Automatic transmission|automatic]]{{cite web|title=A buff new Buick Enclave|url=http://www.autonews.com/article/20160725/OEM04/160729926/a-buff-new-buick-enclave|website=Automotive News|date=25 July 2016|accessdate=31 July 2016}} | wheelbase = {{convert|120.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|204.3|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|78.8|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|69.9|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|4359-4685|lb|kg|abbr=on}} | body_style = 4-door [[SUV]] }} [[File:2018 Buick Enclave Avenir AWD (white), front left.jpg|thumb|left|The top-of-the-range Enclave Avenir]] [[File:2018 Buick Enclave rear 10.12.18.jpg|thumb|left|Rear view]] On April 11, 2017, exactly 10 years after the first Enclave was produced, Buick unveiled the second generation Enclave at the Pier 59 Studios during the 2017 New York Auto Show. With the introduction of the compact [[Buick Envision]] in 2016 and the launching of the [[Opel Insignia]]-badged [[Buick Regal|Buick Regal TourX]] wagon, the next generation Enclave moved upmarket, competing with the [[Volvo XC90]], [[Infiniti QX60]], and [[Acura MDX]] in the premium crossover SUV market. The second generation Enclave went on sale in the Fall of 2017 as a 2018 model.[http://www.motortrend.com/news/2018-buick-enclave-shows-off-new-grille/ "2018 Buick Enclave Shows Off New Front Grille"] from Motor Trend (March 14, 2017){{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2016/07/18/2018-buick-enclave-spy-shots/|title=2018 Buick Enclave slims down for spy shots|first=Reese|last=Counts|work=Autoblog|date=July 18, 2016|accessdate=July 20, 2016}} The long-wheelbase version of GM’s C1XX chassis sharing the same platform with the [[Chevrolet Traverse]], the second generation Enclave moved away from the egg-shaped design but retains some elements of the previous generation, displaying a sleeker aerodynamic appearance, a lower roofline, and the introduction of the Evonik Acrylite exterior forward lighting flanking Buick's new three-dimensional mesh grille with chrome wings. Powered by a 3.6-liter V-6 mated to a new nine-speed automatic transmission, it produces {{Convert|310|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}} with {{Convert|266|ftlb|Nm|abbr=on}} torque. The second generation Enclave comes in standard Front-drive or available with Intelligent AWD with an active twin-clutch rear differential, which compliments its first switchable all-wheel-drive system. There are three level trims, including a new top of the line premium Avenir sub-brand.[http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/enclave/2018/2018-buick-enclave-avenir-first-look-review/ "2018 Buick Enclave Avenir First Look: Redesigned Flagship Crossover is Ready"] from ''Motor Trend'' (April 11, 2017) {{-}} ===Chinese version=== {{Infobox automobile | name = Chinese version | image = Buick Enclave (Chinese Version) 001.jpg | production = 2019–present | assembly = [[Jinqiao]], [[Pudong]], [[Shanghai]], China ([[SAIC-GM]]) | engine = 2.0 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine#LSY|LSY]]'' [[I4 engine|I4]] (gasoline) | wheelbase = {{convert|2863|mm|in|1|order=flip|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4981|mm|in|1|order=flip|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1953|mm|in|1|order=flip|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1732|mm|in|1|order=flip|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert|1880-2050|kg|lb|order=flip|abbr=on}} | related = [[Chevrolet Blazer (crossover)|Chevrolet Blazer]] (Chinese version) }} [[File:Buick Enclave (Chinese Version) 002.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Enclave]] On October 22, 2019, Buick unveiled the Chinese-market Enclave. It is a "mid-size plus" version of the Enclave which utilizes GM's C1 short wheelbase platform. It went on sale in that region in late 2019. While it has the similar features as the full-size North American Enclave, the Chinese version is shorter with a design different from its counterpart; there are no plans to make it available in North America. Buick planned to name the Chinese version "Envoy" (a name previously used on [[GMC Envoy|a GMC midsize SUV]] in North America from 1998 to 2007) but elected to use the Enclave name instead.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/04/buick-pre-announces-all-new-enclave-for-end-this-year/ "Buick Pre-Announces All New Enclave For End This Year"] from GM Authority (April 24, 2019)[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/08/all-new-buick-enclave-leaked-for-china/ "All-New Buick Enclave Leaked For China"] from GM Authority (August 16, 2019) The Chinese Enclave features GM's Electronic Precision Shift technology, and is equipped exclusively with a turbocharged 2.0L LSY engine that makes 233 horsepower, mated to the new GM 9-speed automatic transmission.[http://gmauthority.com/blog/2019/10/this-is-the-all-new-buick-enclave-crossover-for-china/ "This Is The All New Buick Enclave Crossover For China"] from GM Authority (October 22, 2019) {{clear}} == Sales == {| class="wikitable" |- ! {{distinguish|Hyundai Excel}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Buick Excelle | image = Buick Excelle II 02 China 2019-03-14.jpg | manufacturer = [[Shanghai GM]] | production = 2003–present | assembly = China: [[Shanghai]] | class = [[Compact car|Compact]] ([[C-segment|C]]) | predecessor = [[Buick Sail]] | successor = }} The '''Buick Excelle''' ({{zh|t=別克凱越}} is the common name for the [[compact car]]s marketed by [[Shanghai General Motors|Shanghai General Motors Company Limited]] ({{zh|t=上海通用汽車有限公司}}) under GM's [[Buick]] brand. The original Buick Excelle (Chinese "Kai Yue"){{cite web |url=http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |title=Excelle the best selling car in China? Yes, and mostly no |work=China Car Times |date=26 January 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120128092620/http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |archive-date=28 January 2012}} is based on the [[Daewoo Lacetti]] developed in [[South Korea]] by [[Daewoo Motors]]. While this car was originally sold worldwide under the [[Daewoo]] brand, in 2004, [[General Motors]] rebranded all Daewoo products in Europe as [[Chevrolet]]s. Parallel to the Lacetti-based Excelle, Shanghai GM introduced a new car called the "[[Buick Excelle GT]]" in China, but called "Ying Lang" in Chinese.{{cite web |url=http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |title=Buick China | Excelle the best selling car in China? Yes, and mostly no. |publisher=chinacartimes.com |location=Qingdao, Shandong, 266071, China |author=FrankF |date=26 January 2012 |accessdate=1 October 2012}} It is based on GM's [[GM Delta platform#Delta II|global compact car platform "Delta II"]] which is developed at [[Rüsselsheim]] in [[Opel]]'s International Technical Development Center (ITDC). The [[Chevrolet Cruze]] is based on this same platform. Since the 2009 economic crises and the subsequent demise of the [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn brand]] and reduction of GM's North American brands to four, the Opel models are aligned no longer with the Saturn brand, but the Buick brand. Consequently, the models built and marketed by Buick China are twins of the Opel variants of GM's global platforms. In China, a [[hatchback]] called the '''[[Buick Excelle XT]]''' debuted in 2009, which is essentially a rebadged [[Opel Astra#Astra J|Astra J (2009–present)]]. A sedan debuted in 2010 called the '''[[Buick Excelle GT]]''' ({{zh|t=别克英朗GT}}).http://www.autoguide.com/auto-news/2010/01/report-upcoming-buick-premium-compact-sedan-rendered.html An estate car based on the second generation Buick Excelle GT debuted in 2018 called the '''[[Buick Excelle GX]]'''. In August 2016, Buick decided to end Excelle production despite strong sales, with 2.68 million units sold over the course of 13 years. Citing its low price while the brand moves upmarket as a main reason, there will be no direct successor, with [[Chevrolet]] and [[Wuling Motors|Wuling]] filling in the low-end market niche left unoccupied by the departure of the Excelle.{{cite web |last=De Feijter |first=Tycho |date=9 August 2016 |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/tychodefeijter/2016/08/09/gm-retires-its-popular-buick-excelle-in-china-after-13-years/ |title=GM China Retires The Buick Excelle After 13 Years Of Stellar Sales |work=[[Forbes]] |access-date=10 August 2016}} In June 2018, Buick launched the second generation of the Buick Excelle. Positioning under the Excelle GT, the second generation Excelle was based on a new platform and stand as a completely new model. == First generation (2003–2016) == {{Infobox automobile | name = First generation | image = Buick Excelle facelift 01 China 2012-04-22.JPG | production = 2003–2016 | assembly = China: [[Shanghai]]

The HRV and wagon were produced from 2005 to 2009 while the sedan continued to produced locally in [[Shanghai]] from April 2003 to August 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/tychodefeijter/2016/08/09/gm-retires-its-popular-buick-excelle-in-china-after-13-years/#66fb80512fc9|title=GM China Retires The Buick Excelle After 13 Years Of Stellar Sales}} The model year 2008 received a facelift consisting of a new front fascia, new rear end design and updated interior. The facelift was partly inspired by the [[Buick Park Avenue]], and the front light units and bumpers were redesigned while the front fenders remain the same units. A second facelift consisting of a new [[grille (car) | grille]] was released in 2013. A 1.6 litre engine was standard under the trim level LX until 2013 where a 1.5 litre engine replaced it. The new trim levels were 1.5 MT Classical, 1.5 MT Premium, 1.5 AT Classical and 1.5 AT Premium. Pricing was between 96,900 yuan to 118,900 yuan throughout its production run. {{clear}} In the Taiwanese market, [[Yulon Motors]], being the manufacturer and distributor of GM products in Taiwan introduced a redesigned Buick Excelle produced and sold exclusively in Taiwan starting from 2007. The Taiwanese version consists of a completely different front fascia compared to the version sold in main land China while the rear is still similar to the [[Chevrolet Optra]], [[Daewoo Lacetti]], and [[Suzuki Forenza]] sedans with only the inner taillamp setup being redesigned. === Gallery === File:Buick Excelle China 2012-06-17.JPG|Buick Excelle front (pre-facelift) File:Buick Excelle 02 China 2012-05-27.JPG|Buick Excelle rear (pre-facelift) File:Buick Excelle facelift 01 China 2012-04-28.JPG|Buick Excelle front (facelift) File:Buick Excelle facelift 02 China 2012-04-22.JPG|Buick Excelle rear (facelift) File:Buick Excelle HRV China 2012-04-15.JPG|Buick Excelle HRV File:Buick Excelle HRV China 2012-04-14.JPG|Buick Excelle HRV rear File:Buick Excelle Wagon 01 China 2012-04-29.JPG|Buick Excelle Wagon front File:Buick Excelle Wagon 02 China 2012-04-29.JPG|Buick Excelle Wagon rear File:Buick Excelle.JPG|Taiwanese market Buick Excelle == Second generation (2018–present) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Second generation | image = Buick Excelle II 002.jpg | aka = | related = [[Chevrolet Onix]] | production = 2018–present | assembly = China: [[Shanghai]] | body styles = 4-door [[sedan]] | engine = 1.3 L ''[[GM Ecotec engine|EcoTec]]'' [[Inline-4 engine|I4]] | transmission = 6-speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
[[Continuously variable transmission|CVT]] | platform = GM GEM platform | wheelbase = {{convert|2611|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}{{cite web|url=https://carnewschina.com/2018/05/10/this-is-the-new-buick-excelle-sedan-for-china/|title=This Is The New Buick Excelle Sedan For China}} | length = {{convert|4468|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1765|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1469|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} }} [[File:Buick Excelle II 003.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Excelle second generation rear]] The second generation Buick Excelle was available in the Chinese market on June 22, 2018.{{cite web|url=https://carnewschina.com/2018/06/12/new-buick-excelle-to-hit-the-chinese-car-market-on-june-22/|title=New Buick Excelle To Hit The Chinese Car Market On June 22}} Based on the all new GEM platformhttp://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/05/new-buick-excelle-sedan-rides-on-this-all-new-gm-vehicle-platform/, the second generation Buick Excelle is powered by a new 1.3 liter, dual-injection inline-4 engine producing {{convert|79|kW|hp|abbr=on}} and {{convert|133|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} torque. Transmission options include a 6-speed manual and a CVT.{{cite web|url=https://carnewschina.com/2018/05/24/more-on-the-new-buick-excelle-sedan-for-china/|title=More On The New Buick Excelle sedan For China}}{{cite press release|url=https://media.gm.com/media/cn/en/buick/news.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2018/June/0622_Buick-Excelle-China.html|title=Buick Launches All-New Excelle in China|date=2018-06-22|publisher=GM Media China}} {{clear}} == References == {{reflist}} {{Buick Vehicles}} {{Buick China timeline}} {{GM Korea}} [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:2010s cars]] [[Category:Buick vehicles|Excelle]] [[Category:Cars of China]]

{{short description|Chinese compact car}} {{distinguish|Hyundai Excel}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Buick Excelle GT | image = File:2018 Buick Excelle GT (front).jpg | manufacturer = [[Shanghai GM]] | production = 2009–present | assembly = China: [[Shanghai]] | class = [[Compact car|Compact]] }} The '''Buick Excelle GT''' ({{zh|t=别克英朗}}) is the name for the [[compact car]] marketed by [[Shanghai General Motors|Shanghai General Motors Company Limited]] ({{zh|t=上海通用汽車有限公司}}) under GM's [[Buick]] brand. The original [[Buick Excelle]] (Chinese "Kai Yue"){{cite web |url=http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |title=Excelle the best selling car in China? Yes, and mostly no |work=China Car Times |date=26 January 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120128092620/http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |archive-date=28 January 2012}} was based on the [[Daewoo Lacetti]] developed in [[South Korea]] by [[Daewoo Motors]]. Parallel to the Lacetti-based Excelle, Shanghai GM introduced a new car, also called "Buick Excelle" in China, but called "Ying Lang" in Chinese.{{cite web |url=http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |title=Buick China | Excelle the best selling car in China? Yes, and mostly no. |publisher=chinacartimes.com |location=Qingdao, Shandong, 266071, China |author=FrankF |date=26 January 2012 |accessdate=1 October 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120128092620/http://www.chinacartimes.com/2012/01/26/excelle-selling-car-china/ |archive-date=28 January 2012 |url-status=dead }} It is based on GM's [[GM Delta platform#Delta II|global compact car platform "Delta II"]] which was developed at [[Rüsselsheim]] in [[Opel]]'s International Technical Development Center (ITDC). The globally sold [[Chevrolet Cruze]] as well as South Korean market [[Daewoo Lacetti Premiere]] were both based on this same [[GM Delta platform#Delta II|Delta II]] platform. Since the 2009 economic crises and the subsequent demise of the [[Saturn Corporation|Saturn brand]] and reduction of GM's North American brands to four, certain Opel models were no longer aligned with the Saturn brand, but now with the Buick brand instead. Consequently, the models built and marketed by Buick China were twins of some Opel variants of GM's global platforms prior to the purchase of [[Opel]] and [[Vauxhall Motors|Vauxhall]] by [[Groupe PSA]] in 2017. In China, a [[hatchback]] called the '''Buick Excelle XT''' debuted in 2009, which was essentially a rebadged [[Opel Astra#Astra J|Astra J (2009–2015)]]. A sedan debuted in 2010 called the '''Buick Excelle GT''' ({{zh|t=别克英朗GT}}).http://www.autoguide.com/auto-news/2010/01/report-upcoming-buick-premium-compact-sedan-rendered.html A North American version of the Excelle GT was assembled in the United States from 2011 to 2016, and marketed as the [[Buick Verano]]. In August 2016, Buick China decided to end 13 years of production of the original [[Buick Excelle]] (2003-2016) despite strong sales, with 2.68 million units sold over the course of 13 years. Citing its low price while the Buick brand was being moved upmarket in China as a main reason, there was no direct successor, with [[Chevrolet]], [[Baojun]] and [[Wuling Motors|Wuling]] filling in the lower end market niche left unoccupied by the departure of the Buick Excelle.{{cite web |last=De Feijter |first=Tycho |date=9 August 2016 |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/tychodefeijter/2016/08/09/gm-retires-its-popular-buick-excelle-in-china-after-13-years/ |title=GM China Retires The Buick Excelle After 13 Years Of Stellar Sales |work=[[Forbes]]|access-date=10 August 2016}} == First generation (2009–2015) == === Excelle XT (hatchback) === {{Infobox automobile | name = Buick Excelle XT (first generation) | image = Buick Excelle XT 01 China 2012-04-29.JPG | aka = [[Opel Astra]] ([[Europe]])
[[Vauxhall Astra]] ([[United Kingdom]])
[[Holden Astra]] ([[Oceania]]) | production = 2010–2015 | assembly = China: [[Shanghai]] | body styles = 5-door [[hatchback]] | engine = 1.6 L [[GM Family 1 engine|''Family 1'']] [[Inline-4|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.6 L [[GM Family 1 engine|''Family 1'']] [[Inline-4 engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|turbo]] [[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.8 L [[GM Family 1 engine|''Family 1'']] [[I4 engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]]) | transmission = 5 speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
6 speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]] | platform = [[GM Delta platform|Delta II platform]] | wheelbase = {{convert|2685|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4419|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1814|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1487|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}/{{convert|1508|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | designer = Uwe Müller{{cite web |url=http://www.carbodydesign.com/archive/2009/06/23-opel-astra-design/ |title=Opel Astra: design story |publisher=Car Body Design |date=23 June 2009 |accessdate=14 November 2012}} }} {{main article|Opel Astra#Astra_J|l1=Opel Astra}} The Excelle XT hatchback made its debut in late 2009 at the [[Guangzhou Auto Show]] and the Excelle GT saloon in June 2010. The hatch went on sale in China only in January 2010 and the sedan in June 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.carpictures.com/Buick/Excelle-XT-Debuts-in-China-2011-09KTF154611736 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-06-12 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110708122143/http://www.carpictures.com/Buick/Excelle-XT-Debuts-in-China-2011-09KTF154611736 |archivedate=2011-07-08 }} The XT is essentially a rebadged [[Opel Astra]] for the Chinese market only, with the most noticeable differences being Buick badges and a new [[grille (car) | grille]]. Engine options for the Buick Excelle XT include:[http://www.topspeed.com/cars/buick/2010-buick-excelle-xt-ar82047.html 2010 Buick Excelle XT], Top Speed. * 1.6-litre turbocharged four-cylinder gasoline engine that delivers 135 kW. * 1.6-litre inline four-cylinder gasoline engine with a two-stage variable intake manifold that delivers 85 kW. * 1.8-litre DOHC inline four-cylinder gasoline engine that delivers 103 kW. All engines are available with a six-speed automatic transmission featuring a sport mode. File:Buick Excelle XT 01 China 2012-04-22.JPG|Buick Excelle XT hatchback front. File:Buick Excelle XT 02 China 2012-04-22.JPG|Buick Excelle XT hatchback rear. {{clear}} === Excelle GT (sedan) === {{Infobox automobile | name = Buick Excelle GT (first generation) | image = Buick Excelle GT 01 China 2012-05-20.JPG | aka = [[Buick Verano]] | production = 2010–2015 | assembly = China: [[Shanghai]] | body styles = 4-door [[sedan]] | engine = 1.6 L [[GM Family 1 engine|''Family 1'']] [[I4 engine|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]])

6 speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]] | platform = [[GM Delta platform|Delta II platform]] | wheelbase = {{convert|2685|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4671|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1814|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1483|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} }} {{main article|Buick Verano}} Another version of the [[Opel Astra]] that shares the design cues of the Excelle GT is assembled and marketed in North America as the [[Buick Verano]]. Production of the Verano began in the fourth quarter of 2011 at the General Motors [[Orion Assembly]] plant. The Verano went on sale late in 2011 as a 2012 model. File:Buick Excelle GT 01 China 2012-04-08.JPG|Buick Excelle GT sedan front. File:Buick Excelle GT 02 China 2012-04-08.JPG|Buick Excelle GT sedan rear. {{clear}} == Second generation (2015–present) == {{Infobox automobile | name = Buick Excelle GT (second generation) | image = File:2018 Buick Excelle GT (facelift).jpg | caption = | aka = Buick Excelle GX (station wagon) | production = 2015–present | assembly = China: [[Wuhan]] (SAIC-GM Wuhan Branch) | body style = 4-door [[Sedan (automobile)|sedan]]
5-door [[station wagon]] | layout = [[Front-engine, front-wheel-drive layout|Front-engine, front-wheel drive]] | platform = [[GM Delta II platform#D2XX/D2UX|D2XX]] or GM-PATAC K | engine = 1.0 L ''LJI'' [[Straight-three engine|I3]] ([[turbocharger|turbo]] [[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.3 L ''LI6'' [[Straight-three engine|I3]] ([[turbocharger|turbo]] [[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.4 L ''LFF'' [[Inline-4 engine|I4]] ([[turbocharger|turbo]] [[Petrol engine|petrol]])
1.5 L ''[[Daewoo S-Tec engine|L2B]]'' [[Inline-4|I4]] ([[Petrol engine|petrol]]) | transmission = 6 speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
5 speed [[Manual transmission|manual]]
6 speed [[Automatic transmission|automatic]]
6 speed [[dual-clutch transmission|DCT]]
7 speed [[dual-clutch transmission|DCT]] | wheelbase = {{convert|2640|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | length = {{convert|4587|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | width = {{convert|1798|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | height = {{convert|1463|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} | related = {{ubl|[[Buick GL6]]|[[Buick Verano]] (2nd generation)|[[Chevrolet Monza (China)]]|[[Roewe i5]]}} | designer = Yin He | sp = }} A new Buick Excelle GT was introduced as a 2015 model. The new model has a completely new look, with new front and rear bumpers, new lights, new grille, and a more luxurious cabin. New engines included are a 1.4-liter turbocharged engine mated to a seven speed dual clutch gearbox or a 1.5-liter {{convert|113|hp|kW|abbr=on}} mated to a five speed manual or six-speed automatic gearbox. Trim levels for this model are called 15N and 18T. Production of the new model began in March 2015. File:Buick Excelle GT II China 2016-04-18.jpg|Pre-facelift Buick Excelle GT sedan front. File:Buick Excelle GT II 02 China 2015-04-10.jpg|Pre-facelift Buick Excelle GT sedan side. File:Buick Excelles.jpg|Pre-facelift Buick Excelle GT sedans front and rear. === 2018 facelift === In late 2017, Buick announced a facelift update for the 2018 model year that adds the new Buick grilles with the spreading wings to the Verano and Excelle products. The update applies to the Buick Verano sedan/hatchback, Buick Excelle GT sedan, and added a Buick Excelle GX station wagon as an additional new body style. 1 litre and 1.3 litre three cylinder engines were added to the range along with both 6 speed manual and dual clutch gearboxes.{{cite web|url=https://car.autohome.com.cn/config/spec/32189.html#pvareaid=3454541|title=2018 Buick Excelle 15T/18T specs}} File:Buick Excelle GT II facelift China 2018-03-20.jpg|2018 Buick Excelle GT facelift front. {{Infobox automobile |name = Buick Park Avenue |image = 2001 Buick Park Avenue.jpg |manufacturer=[[General Motors]] (1991-2005)

[[Front-engine, rear-wheel-drive layout|FR layout]] (2007–2012) |predecessor = [[Buick Electra]]
[[Holden Caprice#WL|Buick Royaum]] (China) |successor = [[Buick Lucerne]] }} The '''Buick Park Avenue''' is a [[full-size car]] built by [[Buick]]. The nameplate was first used in 1975 for an appearance option package on the [[Buick Electra|Electra 225 Limited]]. It became an Electra trim level in 1978 and its own model starting in the 1991 model year after the Electra was discontinued. There were two generations of the Park Avenue that were manufactured in the United States until 2005. In 2007, the nameplate was revived on a large Buick sedan built by [[Shanghai GM]] for the Chinese market based on the [[Holden Caprice]] from the [[Holden Caprice (WM)|WM/WN]] range. The nameplate is derived from the affluent [[New York City]] [[boulevard]], [[Park Avenue]]. {{TOC left}} {{Clear}} ==As a sub-model (1975-1990)== {{Main article|Buick_Electra#1971–1976|l1=Buick Electra Park Avenue}} '''1975-1976''' Park Avenue first appeared as an appearance package on the [[Buick Electra#1977%E2%80%931984|1975 Buick Electra Limited]]. It included similar seats to the [[Cadillac Sixty Special]], optional full center console, [[Buick_V8_engine|Buick 455ci V8]], posi-traction, 15" rallye sport wheels, rear automatic leveling, optional leather, optional [[Airbag|Air Cushion Restraint System]], remote mirror with thermometer, and automatic climate control. The 1976 cars were largely the same except for some styling revisions and added emissions systems.{{Cite web|url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/75_47.html|title=1975 Buick|website=www.lov2xlr8.no}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/75_61.html|title=1975 Buick|website=www.lov2xlr8.no}} {{cite web |url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/76buk/bilder/10.jpg |title=Photo |website=www.lov2xlr8.no|format=JPG|access-date=2019-08-09}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.v8buick.com/index.php?threads/1975-park-ave-executive-deluxe-prototype.305447/|title=1975 Park Ave Executive Deluxe Prototype|website=V8buick.com}} '''1977-1984''' Park Avenue, previously an appearance option package, became an official trim level on the Electra in 1978. Cosmetically, a different grille and redesigned tail lights were the only notable cosmetic changes that year but 1979 brought a redesigned, flat front end and a subtly different taillight treatment featuring a Buick crest and bisecting horizontal silver line. A more extensive redesign occurred for the 1980 model year.{{Cite web|url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/79bu/3.html|title=Auto Brochure|website=www.lov2xlr8.no}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/78bui/bilder/6.jpg |title=Photo |website=www.lov2xlr8.no|format=JPG|access-date=2019-08-09}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/82ble/bilder/2.jpg |title=Photo |website=www.lov2xlr8.no|format=JPG|access-date=2019-08-09}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/84bel/bilder/3.jpg |title=Photo |website=www.lov2xlr8.no|format=JPG|access-date=2019-08-09}} '''1985-1990''' Park Avenue remained the top trim on the Buick Electra, it was redesigned along with the rest of the Electra line up moving to the front wheel drive GM C-Body. It featured upgraded upholstery/seating, premium sound, optional leather, and standard [[Buick_V6_engine#4.1|Buick 3800 V6]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.curbsideclassic.com/curbside-classics-american/curbside-classic-1985-buick-electra-park-avenue-best-dressed-c-body-of-the-year/|title=Curbside Classic: 1985 Buick Electra Park Avenue – Best-Dressed C-Body Of The Year|first=Tom|last=Klockau}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/85electra/bilder/5.jpg |title=Photo |website=www.lov2xlr8.no|format=JPG|access-date=2019-08-09}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/86buce/86buce.html|title=lov2xlr8.no|website=www.lov2xlr8.no}} '''Park Avenue Ultra''' In 1989 and 1990, Buick introduced the Park Avenue Ultra trim level. The Ultra was essentially an upgrade to the Electra Park Avenue line, and featured a standard leather interior with dual 20-way power front seats (shared with Cadillac's restyled 1989 [[Cadillac_Sixty_Special|Cadillac Fleetwood Sixty Special]]), lower-body accent exterior paint treatment, distinctive thick-padded vinyl top with limousine-style rear-window surround (available only on Ultra), simulated burled elm trim on the doors and instrument panel, unique aluminum wheels, anti-lock brakes, chromed B-pillar moldings, specific grille and tail lamps, leather-wrapped steering wheel, electronic instrumentation, padded glove-compartment door, unique interior door panel trim, and a variety of otherwise minor changes. With its long list of standard equipment, the Park Avenue Ultra carried a higher base price than Cadillac's Sedan de Ville. The Park Avenue Ultra did not gain much popular recognition, however, until the following generation of Park Avenue where the "Ultra" badge offered even more features.{{Cite web|url=http://www.lov2xlr8.no/brochures/buick/90bb.html|title=Brochures|website=www.lov2xlr8.no}} ==Essence concept car== [[File:1989 Buick Park Avenue Essence White 01.jpg|thumb|left|1989 Buick Park Avenue Essence ]] The '''Buick Park Avenue Essence''' was a [[concept car]] designed and engineered by the [[Buick]] division of [[General Motors]] to showcase advanced technology and styling. First shown in 1989 in a light green metallic color, the Essence made rounds through the auto show circuits later in a light white. Inside the Essence was a wide, sweeping instrument panel that housed a prototype [[Delco Electronics|Delco]] Navicar navigation system among other innovations. Smooth, graceful body lines forecast the eventual production Park Avenue, introduced in 1990. The Essence was powered by the then-new 165 hp version of Buick's 3800 OHV V6 engine. {{clear}} ==First generation (1991–1996)== {{Infobox automobile |name = First generation |image = 1st-Buick-Park-Avenue.jpg | type = Passenger car | manufacturer = Buick |production = 1990–1996 |model_years = 1991–1996 |assembly = [[Hamtramck, Michigan]], United States

1994–96: {{convert|55.1|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} | weight = {{convert | 3536|lbs|abbr=on}} | predecessor = [[Buick Electra]] | yearconstruction = 1991-1996 }} The 1991 Park Avenue, introduced in July 1990, utilized GM's [[GM C platform (FWD)|C platform]]. It was previewed by the 1989 Park Avenue Essence show car and the Park Avenue's silhouette was often compared to that of contemporary [[Jaguar Cars|Jaguars]] and many of its styling cues, which included a large 'dollar-grin' grille mounted to the hood, rounded lines, and full-width tail lamps. These styling cues made their way to other Buick models restyled in the 1990s. The Park Avenue was Buick's largest front wheel drive sedan, but the even larger rear wheel drive [[Buick Roadmaster#1991–1996|Roadmaster]] returned to the lineup in 1991 for the station wagon and 1992 for the sedan. While not the largest vehicle offered by Buick, as that distinction belonged to the [[Buick Roadmaster|Roadmaster]], the Park Avenue was the most luxurious and considered the flagship of the marque.{{fact|date=September 2008}} The base model Park Avenue came with a 3.8 L naturally-aspirated V6 engine and plush velour interior upgradeable to leather. Starting in 1992, the ''Ultra'' came with a 3.8 L Supercharged V6 engine and standard leather interior. The Park Avenue received various exterior and interior cosmetic changes, as well as powertrain updates, during this run. Some of the new options and features added to the first generation included driver (and later passenger) airbags, dual zone climate control, traction control, and variable-effort steering (Ultra only). ===European Market=== The Park Avenue was available in [[Europe]] from 1991 to 1996 and varied from the North American version by featuring a truncated taillamps with separate amber turn signal indicators and red brake lamps, wider numberplate bezel, fitment of rear red fog lamps, headlamps with different lens pattern, white front side running markers, amber front turn signal indicators, side turn signal repeaters, "flagpole" external rear-view mirrors (mirrors on US version are fixed and do not turn), stronger seat belt and anchors, "softer" air bags, metric speedometer and gauges. They are to comply with the [[World Forum for Harmonization of Vehicle Regulations|European regulatory and safety standards]]. This generation of the Park Avenue was the last Buick to be officially marketed by GM in Europe. This move was to reduce the "cluttered" model range that confused the European consumers. After 1996, Cadillac and Chevrolet remained the sole General Motors North American brands to be sold in Europe. The base trim featured a hood ornament while the Ultra had a less conspicuous tri-shield inset on the upper edge of the grille. The base Park Avenue was the last [[United States domestic market|USDM]] Buick to carry a factory hood ornament. For 2001, the base model's cloth interior was dropped as an option in favor of now standard leather trim. Ultrasonic rear park assist was a new option that year as well. For 2003, trademark Buick "[[Ventiport]]s" returned on the Park Avenue Ultra along with a bolder grille that carried a larger monochromatic tri-shield badge in the center. New 17 inch wheels, a revised interior and revised instrument cluster were changed for the 2003 model year on the Ultra. For 2005, the final model year in North America, base Park Avenues received a revised grille, and the previously Ultra-exclusive Ventiports. Also, the rear fascia was redone across the model line with a prominent chrome bar above the license plate holder with an embossed ''Park Avenue'' script and amber turn signal flashers. The last 3,000 of 7,000 Park Avenues carried Special Edition badging that featured the namesake script underneath a silhouette of the [[New York City]] skyline. 300 of these were painted with a special two-tone black-on-platinum finish. Production ended on June 18, 2004.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cargurus.com/Cars/2005-Buick-Park-Avenue-Overview-c5290|title=Buick Park Avenue|website=CarGurus}} The Park Avenue was discontinued after 2005 in the North American market and was replaced in 2006 by the [[Buick Lucerne]]. {{clear}} ==Third generation (2007–2012)== {{Main|Holden Caprice (WM)}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Third Generation | image = Buick Park Avenue CN China 2012-05-27.jpg | manufacturer = [[SAIC-GM|GM Shanghai]] | aka = [[Holden Special Vehicles ]] Grange/Senator [[Holden Caprice (WM)|Holden Caprice/Statesman]]

Like its predecessor, the vehicle is based on the [[Australia]]n-built [[Holden Caprice]] (this time on the contemporary [[Holden Caprice (WM)|WM/WN generation]]), though, unlike the Royaum, it was assembled by [[SAIC-GM|Shanghai GM]] from [[knock-down kit|CKD]] kits shipped from Holden's Elizabeth factory in South Australia.{{cite web|last=Dornin|first=Tim|date=11 April 2007|url=http://www.drive.com.au/Editorial/ArticleDetail.aspx?ArticleId=37768|title=WM Statesman derived Buick to be assembled from CKD kits and sold in China|publisher=[[Fairfax Media]]|accessdate=15 April 2007|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130816132314/http://www.drive.com.au/Editorial/ArticleDetail.aspx?ArticleId=37768|archivedate=16 August 2013}} It is offered in five trim levels: 舒适型 (Comfort), 精英型 (Elite), 豪华型 (Luxury - 2.8 only), 旗舰型 (Flagship) and 旗舰版 (Ultimate - 2010 only) The Park Avenue was powered by Australian-built versions of the [[GM High Feature engine]]. The standard engines were the 2.8 L [[GM High Feature engine#LP1|''LP1'']] and the 3.6 L [[GM High Feature engine#LY7|''LY7'']] engine available as an option on the Elite and Flagship models from 2007 to 2009. The [[engine control unit]] is a [[Robert Bosch GmbH|Bosch]] E77 32-bit ECM processor.{{cite web |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2007/04/10/buick-reintroduces-the-park-avenue-in-china/|title=Buick reintroduces the Park Avenue...in China|author=Nunez, Alex|work=Autoblog|date=10 April 2007}} {| class="wikitable" |- !Type!!Displacement!!Power!!Torque |- |2.8 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LP1|LP1]]'' V6||{{convert|2792|cc|0|abbr=on}}||{{convert|150|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} at 6500 rpm ||{{convert|265|Nm|abbr=on}} at 2600 rpm |- |3.6 L ''[[GM High Feature engine#LY7|LY7]]'' V6||{{convert|3564|cc|0|abbr=on}}||{{convert|187|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} at 6600 rpm ||{{convert|340|Nm|abbr=on}} at 2800 rpm |- |3.0 L ''[[GM High Feature engine##LF1|LF1]]'' V6||{{convert|2994|cc|0|abbr=on}}||{{convert|187|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} at 6700 rpm ||{{convert|296|Nm|abbr=on}} at 2900 rpm |} In 2010, only one engine option was offered, a 3 L SIDI (251 bhp) replacing the old 2.8 V6 and 3.6 V6 due to fuel consumption with the 2.8 litre engine rated at 11.4 litres per 100 kilometres (20.6 MPG US) and the 3.6 litre engine rated 11.6 litres per 100 kilometres (20.3 MPG US) respectively. The 3 litre engine was rated 10.9 litres per 100 kilometres (21.6 MPG US). The third-generation Park Avenue remained a China exclusive and was never offered by Buick in North America. A version of the car did eventually see release in the US market as the stripped down, rebadged [[Chevrolet Caprice#Sixth generation (2006–2017)|Chevrolet Caprice PPV]] (Police Patrol Vehicle). The car was discontinued in China in October 2012.{{cite web |url=http://chinaautoweb.com/2012/10/buick-park-avenue-is-coming-to-an-end/ |title=Buick Park Avenue Is Coming to an End |author= |date=22 October 2012 |website=ChinaAutoWeb |publisher= |accessdate=2 September 2014}} {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110904055545/http://consumerguideauto.howstuffworks.com/1991-to-1996-buick-park-avenue.htm 1991-1996 Buick Park Avenue: Overview] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110903230219/http://consumerguideauto.howstuffworks.com/1997-to-2005-buick-park-avenue.htm 1997-2005 Buick Park Avenue: Overview] *Buick official page: [https://web.archive.org/web/20091110163131/http://www.buick.com.cn/ParkAvenue/index.aspx China] {{Buick Vehicles}} {{Buick}} {{Buick China timeline}} [[Category:Buick vehicles|Park Avenue]] [[Category:Front-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Full-size vehicles]] [[Category:Sedans]] [[Category:Motor vehicles manufactured in the United States]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 1990]] [[Category:1990s cars]] [[Category:2000s cars]] [[Category:Park Avenue]]

{{short description|Show car built by Steve Scott in 1965}} {{single source|date=November 2018}} '''''Uncertain T''''' is a [[show car]] built by ''[[Car Craft]]'' photographer Steve Scott in 1965.
== Construction details == The chassis is steel tube, painted red.<ref>Ganahl records ''Car Craft'' calling it 6061-T6 aluminum, but believes Scott would have polished rather than painted it, in that event. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76 and caption.</ref> The 1957 [[Buick]] [[Buick V8 engine#Buick "Nailhead" V8 (2nd generation)|nailhead]],<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref> block painted brown with red detailing,<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76 caption.</ref> was [[Hot Rod#Language|bored and stroked]] to {{convert|386|cid|cc|abbr=on}} and equipped with 11:1 [[compression ratio|compression]] [[Jahns]] [[piston]]s, [[Stuart Hilborn|Hilborn]] [[Fuel injection|injector]]s, [[Scheiefer]] [[Ignition magneto|magneto]], 1963 Buick [[cylinder head]]s, and [[Exhaust manifold|open headers]].<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.74 caption and photo.</ref> The transmission and quick-change rear axle casing were painted brown, the [[rack and pinion]] and [[torsion bar]] tube yellow.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76 caption.</ref>
The body was [[fiberglass]],<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76.</ref> resembling the [[Ford Model T|Model T]] "phonebooth" [[coupé]], steeply raked forward, with a "wind-up key" in the rear section.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75 photo.</ref> When it debuted, the body was painted a deep candy red (applied by [[Bill Cushenberry]]).<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76.</ref> The upholstery was done by [[Lee Wells]].<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76.</ref> The steering wheel was a four-spoke design, mounted vertically.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76 photo.</ref>
The car ran on narrow spoked motorcycle wheels in front and wide five-spoked wheels in back.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref>
Torsion bar front suspension was a rarity in customs (or any cars) at the time.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76.</ref> Scott's use of a 1960 [[MG MGA|MGA]] rack and pinion to operate the [[drag link]] was also innovative.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76.</ref>
While the car ran, it had no suspension, no shock absorbers, and no front brakes, effectively making it a [[Custom car#Language|trailer queen]].<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76 caption.</ref> == History ==
''Uncertain T'' debuted at a carshow as part of the [[1965 NHRA Winternationals|1965 Winternats]] at [[Auto Club Raceway Pomona|Pomona]] in February 1965, and appeared in the May issue of ''Car Craft''.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref> It was on the cover of November's ''Car Craft'', which had a three-page feature (with only black and white photos) inside.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref>
About a month after completion, Scott had the car repainted metalflake brick orange by [[Junior's House of Color]], before entering "Uncertain T" in the [[1965 Oakland Roadster Show|Oakland Roadster Show]];<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, pp.75-6.</ref> in this new color scheme, it toured the U.S., and won a number of trophies.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76.</ref> Some time later, the engine and chassis details were repainted yellow.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.76 caption.</ref>
"Uncertain T" also appeared in [[Hot Rod (magazine)|''Hot Rod'']] in July, August, and September 1966.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref> In the September issue, it was listed as for sale, with a price of US$7000; usual for a used [[custom car]] was $2000 to $3000.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref>
In 1966, "Uncertain T" was offered as a [[Monogram]] [[Scale model|model kit]].<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref>
Around 1970, the car, then painted metallic gold, was sold to a California resident. Ownership could not be established, and in 2003 was still unknown.<ref>Ganahl, Pat. "Uncertain T", in ''Street Rodder'', July 2003, p.75.</ref>

{{Convert|410|km|abbr=on}} (Plus) | charging = {{unbulleted list | [[Alternating current|AC]]: 6 hours (Plus: 8 hours) | [[Direct current|DC]] Fast Charge: 0.67 hours to 80%}} | wheelbase = {{Convert|2660|mm|abbr=on}} | length = {{Convert|4650|mm|abbr=on}} | width = {{Convert|1817|mm|abbr=on}} | height = {{Convert|1510|mm|abbr=on}} | weight = {{Convert|1540-1675|kg|abbr=on}} | related = [[Chevrolet Menlo]] | designer = Longbai Yang | predecessor = | sp = }} The '''Buick Velite 6''' (微蓝) is an [[electric vehicle|electric]] compact station wagon, also known as a "multi-activity vehicle" (MAV), sold exclusively in China. ==History== [[File:Buick Velite 6 003.jpg|thumb|left|Buick Velite 6 rear quarter]] The Velite 6 was previewed with the Velite [[concept car]] in 2016{{cite web|url=https://gmauthority.com/blog/2016/11/buick-velite-concept-debuts-in-china-ushers-in-buick-blue-strategy/|title=Buick Velite Concept Debuts In China, Ushers In ‘Buick Blue’ Strategy|publisher=GM Authority|date=2016-11-18}} (not to be confused with the [[Buick Velite|2004 concept]] of the same name). In April 2018, two production-intent models were unveiled; one electric, and the other a plug-in hybrid.{{cite web|url=https://gmauthority.com/blog/2018/04/buick-velite-6-bows-for-china-in-plug-in-and-battery-electric-variants/|title=Buick Velite 6 Bows For China In Plug-In And Battery-Electric Variants|publisher=GM Authority|date=2018-04-17}}. The production Buick Velite 6 debuted at the 2019 [[Shanghai Auto Show]] in April. It is currently only available as an all-electric vehicle, with two battery options available.https://media.gm.com/content/dam/Media/documents/CN/Vehicle_Spec/Buick/VELITE-6/Buick%20VELITE%206%20Family%20Product%20Specifications.pdf The Velite 6 is available in three variants: Entry, Middle, and Luxury. It also features three driving modes (standard, sport, and economy){{clarify|date=February 2020}} and three levels of energy recycling. ==Velite 6 Plus== The Buick Velite 6 Plus was introduced in October 2019. The Velite 6 Plus has a larger battery, with 52.5 kWh capacity and a range of up to 410 km on the [[New European Driving Cycle|NEDC]].{{cite web|url=https://media.gm.com/media/cn/en/buick/home.detail.html/content/Pages/news/cn/en/2019/Oct/1012_Buick_VELITE_6.html|title=Buick Launches VELITE 6 PLUS MAV Electric Vehicle in China|publisher=Buick|date=2019-10-12}} It generates up to {{convert|110|kW|hp PS|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|350|Nm|lbft|0|abbr=on}} torque. {{clear}} == See also == *[[Chevrolet Bolt]] *[[List of modern production plug-in electric vehicles]] *[[New energy vehicles in China]] *[[Plug-in electric vehicle]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons cat|Buick Velite 6}} * {{official website|https://www.buick.com.cn/velite6/}} {{in lang|zh}} {{Buick China timeline}} [[Category:Buick vehicles|Velite 6]] [[Category:Battery electric cars currently in production]] [[Category:Cars introduced in 2019|Buick Velite 6]] [[Category:2020s cars]] [[Category:Compact cars]] [[Category:Hatchbacks]] [[Category:Cars of China]]
